company_name: Medimaps Group - creators of TBS Osteo powered by TBS iNsight ™ - medical AI technology.
job_description: HOW MIGHT YOU MAKE A DIFFERENCE?Would like to be part of something bigger, where your career will make a real and positive contribution to the world?At the medimaps group, our core mission to improve patient lives is at the heart of everything we do. Driven by this mission, our world class R&D team have developed cutting edge AI powered medical imaging software that assesses bone health and improves fracture risk detection. For the millions of patients worldwide suffering from osteoporosis, medimaps software provides a simple and effective win-win solution for patients and clinicians battling to predict and treat bone health problems.If its time for you to choose a career you can be proud of, medimaps can provide a real and meaningful opportunity for you to change the world of patient care one scan at a time ...As Chief Operations Officer you will play a meaningful role in the growth trajectory of medimaps business. Providing strategic input, cross-functional leadership and driving operational excellence, you will spear head medimaps operational functions to deliver the efficiencies and ‘best in class’ standards required to ensure the successful execution of key business objectives.This is pivotal role at a critical stage of medimaps organizational development and growth, demanding a hands on leader adept at driving efficiency, scalability, and innovation, while maintaining a steadfast focus on quality assurance, regulatory compliance, financial stability, customer satisfaction and employee engagement.As a critical member of the Executive Committee, you will work hand in hand with the CEO and other C-level executives to shape the strategic direction of medimaps.So lets look at the Challenge in more detail : As COO, you will be responsible, for achieving a broad range of business objectives, including :Developing and executing operational strategies that align with the company's goals, fostering sustainable growth within the SaMD industrySpearheading initiatives for financial management, forecasting, and scenario analysis, emphasizing cost-effective resource allocation and profitabilityLeading top-down and inter-collaborative efforts to drive financial planning, performance, and reportingMaintaining the highest standards of financial, legal, and operational complianceChampioning operational decision-making and risk management to ensure operational effectiveness, efficiency, and sustainable growthCultivating a high-performing team culture of accountability and collaboration, emphasizing professional growth and developmentDriving the adoption of advanced technologies, AI and data analytics to streamline operations and deliver valueOverseeing product development from beginning to launch by interacting with the relevant stakeholders to ensure timely delivery of relevant and innovative solutionsFacilitating clear communication and decision-making pathways between the Operational Task Force (OTF) and C-level executivesEnhancing inter-departmental collaboration, ensuring seamless execution of operational initiatives across all levels of the organizationFostering a customer-centric approach, integrating feedback into continuous operational improvements to enhance customer experienceImplementing performance management systems that celebrate success, address challenges proactively, and promote continuous improvementProviding direct hierarchical oversight to Finance & Administration, Product, Human Resources and Regulatory Affairs & Quality Assurance (RAQA). This oversight includes Vice Presidents who do not report to other C-level executives. In addition to this direct oversight, the COO will maintain a functional relationship with the other Executive Officers of the company, acting as a pivotal supporter and advisor to the Chief Executive Officer (CEO).Assessing and aligning team objectives with the company’s strategic goals. This involves setting clear, measurable targets and ensuring that each team and individual understands their role in achieving these targets.What do you need to succeed?The COO we seek is a collaborative partner with the following range of skills:Technical capabilities:A minimum of 10 years of leadership experience in operational (and financial) roles within Life Sciences or related industriesBachelor's degree in Operations Management, Business Administration, Finance, Software Engineering, or a related field; an MBA is a plusHealthcare/Life Science experience is essential, preferably in Medical Device (MD) or Software as a Medical Device (SaMD)Comprehensive knowledge of global regulatory requirements and quality standards in the MD sector, and ideally in SaMDProficiency in financial management, including budgeting, forecasting, and reporting.Exceptional analytical skills and strategic thinking, with a proven track record in operational excellenceAbility to translate and communicate data and analytics into simple and actionable insights and plansExpertise in new technologies, generative AI, Project Management tools, the MS Office suite, and familiarity with Salesforce and QMS are highly valuedUnderstanding of Project Management processes a plusFluency in English is required; business-level French and other languages are a plus.Soft Skills:As a hands-on leader with exceptional emotional intelligence, and an ability to inspire and motivate teams towards our organizational goals, you will need to be:Transparent and Trustworthy Partner,  demonstrating the ability to work in full transparency, respect, and trust with the CEO, embodying a spirit of open communication and mutual support. The ideal candidate will excel in forming a complementary leadership team with the CEO, where their combined strengths and perspectives drive the organization forward in unity and purpose.Strong Leader with an ability to guide teams with clarity, celebrating their achievements and fostering a culture of accountability and collaboration.Emotionally Intelligent. Skilled in self-awareness and empathy, managing emotions effectively to enhance team dynamics, especially under pressure.Poised with bias awareness and composure to successfully navigate uncertain or challenging situations, providing steady leadershipPassionate and Visionary: Exhibiting a deep commitment to our mission, with a positive outlook that inspires innovation and resilienceEmpathic Communicator and decision-maker, ensuring team members feel understood and valuedAdaptable and Collaborative with the agility to change priorities and work collaboratively across functions to achieve shared objectivesRelationship Builder capable of establishing and maintaining strong relationships within and outside the organization, fostering trust and cooperationMediator for conflict resolution and crisis management. Capable of navigating difficult situations with diplomacy while maintaining focus and composure. Leading by example to resolve challenges constructivelyStrategic & Operational Leader who excels in creating an inclusive, dynamic work environment that encourages growth, learning, and continuous improvementWhat you can expect of us?As we work to develop patient centric solutions, we also work hard to take care of our teammates’ professional development, personal growth and well-being.As one of the key hires for the medimaps Group, you will be given the opportunity to build and drive your own Department, to make your mark and have the freedom and creative license to shape the way your Department works.The security of working in an innovative and successful company with a sustainable business modelAs a member of the ExCo Team you will participate in relevant decisions for the future of the groupThe opportunity to work on cross functional projects across teams and country-bordersWorking with an international, multi-cultural and socially responsible company with meaningful corporate values and an inspiring missionWorking with a genuinely great bunch of talented, professional and friendly people, who work hard but know how to have fun and make work a real pleasureAn exciting company mission that brings together science and technology to directly impact the lives of patientsIn addition to this, medimaps offers a competitive compensation and benefits plan that is respectful of work life balance and which encourages eco-friendly commuting options. Apply now for a meaningful career that will really make a difference to you and the people around you. We are looking forward to receiving your application and to getting to know you better!Applications welcome from all Swiss or EU citizens. Please note however that this role will require on-site presence in Geneva.Replies: The hiring process may take a few weeks. We really appreciate your patience and promise to get back to you as soon as we possibly can. Your application is important to us and we will give it the time and attention it deserves.Thank you!Recruitment Agencies please do not reply. We will be managing this hire internally. Thanks for your understanding.

Minimum qualifications:PhD degree in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.Experience with Machine Learning models working with data, quality metrics, quality iterations.One or more scientific publication submission(s) for conferences, journals, or public repositories.Preferred qualifications:Candidates will typically have 1 year of experience owning and initiating research agendas.Coding experience in Python, JavaScript, R, Java, or C++.About The JobAs an organization, Google maintains a portfolio of research projects driven by fundamental research, new product innovation, product contribution and infrastructure goals, while providing individuals and teams the freedom to emphasize specific types of work. As a Research Scientist, you'll setup large-scale tests and deploy promising ideas quickly and broadly, managing deadlines and deliverables while applying the latest theories to develop new and improved products, processes, or technologies. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, our research scientists work on real-world problems that span the breadth of computer science, such as machine (and deep) learning, data mining, natural language processing, hardware and software performance analysis, improving compilers for mobile platforms, as well as core search and much more.As a Research Scientist, you'll also actively contribute to the wider research community by sharing and publishing your findings, with ideas inspired by internal projects as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world.A conversational AI tool that enables users to collaborate with generative AI and help augment their imagination, expand their curiosity, and enhance their productivity.ResponsibilitiesAuthor research papers to share and generate impact of research results across the team and in the research community. Help in growing research business across teams by sharing research trends and best practices within the community. Identify new and upcoming research areas by interacting with potential external and internal collaborators. Help in developing long-term research strategy and plans to expand the impact of Google research with some guidance. Apply state-of-the-art techniques in Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF) and investigate the next generation of model improvements targeting short and mid-term time-horizons.Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Computational Scientist InternAbout Corintis Corintis offers innovative microfluidic cooling technologies for data centers. Our solutions improve compute sustainability and tackle the excessive electricity consumption associated with data center cooling, which consumes more electricity than New York and London combined. By integrating cooling directly inside the chip, we pave the way for the next generation of AI workloads, supporting applications like generative AI systems, climate modeling, and drug discovery to enable the future of sustainable computing. Working at Corintis Corintis offers a friendly and team-oriented workplace bringing together a diverse group of nationalities to solve the biggest computing challenges of tomorrow. Based on the EPFL campus near Lausanne, we are closely connected to the local ecosystem and are located a few minutes walk from Lake Geneva.Job Description:Seeking a motivated developer with expertise in numerical methods, who can work independently and demonstrates resourcefulness. Proactive candidates with prior experience in reading scientific computing literature are preferred. Responsibilities include implementing various algorithms in our Computational Fluid Dynamics software, encompassing new turbulence models and remeshing techniques.Responsibilities:Develop and optimize code for our Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) software using programming languages such as C and Python.Contribute to the development of an adaptive mesh refinement strategy for our simulations.Work collaboratively with our team of engineers and scientists to troubleshoot technical issues in our software.Maintain up-to-date knowledge of new advances in CFD methods.Provide support to the team in the form of code reviews and technical guidance.Develop technical documentation for new and existing features.Present complex research findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.Requirements:Strong academic background in numerical mathematics, computational engineering, computational physics or equivalent education.Experience with programming languages such as C and Python.Comfortable with standard software development practices: version control, continuous integration, code review, etc.Familiarity with numerical methods and their implementation.Excellent written and oral communication skills.Experience with open source finite element software such as FEniCS, firedrake, deal.ii, mfem, ngsolve or gridap.Experience collaborating on open source projects.Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Capable of organizing own work with minimal supervision.What we offerA dynamic, flexible, innovative, and multicultural work environmentStart date: ImmediatelySalary: 2500 CHF gross per monthContract: Paid Internship (6-months preferred, flexible)Activity rate: 100%Location: On-site, Corintis SA (Building C), EPFL innovation park, Switzerland

Minimum qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience. 2 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree. 2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms.2 years of experience with machine learning algorithms and tools (e.g., TensorFlow), artificial intelligence, deep learning, or natural language processing.Preferred qualifications:PhD in Machine Learning or a related field.Experience with Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT) and Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF).Experience working with Large Language Models (LLMs).Ability to grow under pressure in high-stakes, high-visibility environments.Excellent data analysis skills.About The JobGoogle's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.The team is working on all Multimodal efforts across Gemini. We launched image retrieval, image understanding and generation. This includes a significant amount of deep modeling such as supervised fine-tuning (SFT), reinforcement learning with human feedback (RLHF), and iterative process optimization (IPO) establishing data flywheel, etc. Part of the team is also involved in building necessary infrastructure and landing multimodal model capabilities and features.In this role, you will have significant external impact, offering tremendous potential for growth and increased responsibility.A conversational AI tool that enables users to collaborate with generative AI and help augment their imagination, expand their curiosity, and enhance their productivity.ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with Research teams to understand State-Of-The-Art (SOTA) technologies, adapting and integrating them into Gemini/Bard to drive continuous improvement.Leverage Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT), Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF), and Preference Optimization (IPO) to quality hill climb.Conduct in-depth data analysis to uncover insights, pinpoint opportunities, and inform the strategic development of a data flywheel.Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Are you a passionate and innovative engineer who wants to make buildings come alive?We are a young tech startup working on a movable solar facade called Solskin. It combines a PV system and a shading system into one to provide optimal solar energy management and improve occupant comfort. It uses advanced AI algorithms technology using weather and user data to optimize energy savings and comfort. Solskin is a revolutionary product that helps buildings stay cool and generate more solar power than traditional PV systems.As a member of the ZSR team, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology and contribute to the development of Solskin. You will be given a high level of independence and responsibility and will be able to see the tangible results of your work as Solskin is installed on buildings in Switzerland and around the world. You will be supporting us for the testing and validation of our long-lasting system.TasksYou support our development of Solskin by testing our system and improving the system. This entails building test setups, evaluating our system, and finding solutions using prototypes. We like to do as many small iterations as possible. You assist us in documenting design changes and modifications.Involved tasks:Develop prototypes using rapid manufacturing techniques.Test and evaluate system components to assess performance.Provide insights for optimizing the design and functionality based on data analysis.Contribute to the documentation of design changes and improvements.You will work very closely with Gabriel (R&D) and Samuel (Production).RequirementsDegree in mechanical or mechatronic engineeringExperience with CAD tools (i.e. Fusion360)Rapid prototyping (3D Printing and laser cutting)Hands-on Tinkerer experience required. This could be previous exprience with microcontrollers (Arduino, ESP32, STM32) or similar previous mechatronics projectsPython experience is required, C++ would be a plusBenefitsOur values:At ZSR, we have a rule: we're here because we genuinely want to be. We're all driven by the same goal - getting Solskin to the market. If you're someone who gets things done and wants to make an impact, you'll be a key player in shaping how we do things, from our company culture to the direction of our products.Why you'll love ZSR:We offer a flexible hybrid work environment, allowing you to arrange start and finish times around your life (picking up kids, walking the dog, training for your next marathon at lunch). However, we love being in our office together.A great engineering culture, an open-door policy, and a focus on responsibility and mutual trust and supportWorking with a skilled, high-achieving, experienced, and fun team — with lots of opportunities to develop your professional career and grow with the companyTeam events, game nights, and much moreWe offer extensions for interns that excel.If interested, please attach your CV and a motivation letter.If your profile does not exactly match this application we encourage you to send us your application. You can find the contact on our webpage.

Work with existing and prospective customers to identify their needs. Monitor and improve product-market fit. Own the roadmap and prioritize building what matters most. Develop and convey the product vision to internal and external stakeholders. Work closely with the engineering team to drive product development. Familiarity with business analytics tools, SQL, and other product management tools is essential. Ability to achieve strategic goals in a fast-paced environment. Open-minded, sociable, and communicative. Excellent English communication skills, both oral and written. Eligible to work in Switzerland. Whether enabling delivery drivers to make quicker deliveries, matching a patient with their medication or allowing retailers to make store operations more efficient, our technology automates workflows and provides actionable insights to help businesses in a variety of industries. job_title: Internship at ZHAW Neuromorphic Computing Lab: 50%, 4 Months
company_name: ZHAW Zurich University of Applied Sciences
job_description: You can join a dynamic and highly interdisciplinary team to help in either technical work on groundbreaking technology for assistive robots: event-based camera, neuromorphic computing hardware, and novel motion control strategies; or help with performing user studies on requirements and acceptability of assistive robots in healthcare and elderly care.School: Life Sciences und Facility ManagementStarting date: 1 th August 2024Your roleVersion 1, Technical InternshipYou will write software to test a new smart event-based camera that we have recently built You will implement and test neural-network architectures for object detection and tracking or for 3D vision using this camera You will document the software and write a report about your work This work can be formulated as a BSc or MSc thesis and might lead to scientific publications or dem ORORVersion 2, User Study InternshipYou will help to develop questionnaires and use case scenarios (story boards) to find out the requirements, needs, and challenges for robotic assistants in healthcareYou will help determine the relevant stakeholders and fine-tune the interview questions to different groups You will conduct the interviews online or face to face You will analyze the results of the interviews and help formulate a hierarchy of use cases, their requirements and constraints and write a report about the study This work may lead to a publication and can be the basis for a BSc or MSc thesisYour profileOption 1BSc or MSc in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or similarGood programming skills (python, c++); Experience with Machine Learning and/or Computer Vision and/or RoboticsOption 2BSc or MSc in Social Sciences, Humanities, or Life SciencesApply online now­This is what we stand forZurich University of Applied Sciences ZHAW is one of Switzerland's largest multidisciplinary universities of applied sciences, with over 14'000 students and 3'400 faculty and staff.Life Sciences and Facility Management: Study and research in Wädenswil: practical, creative, passionate and reflective. Our expertise in life sciences and facility management in the areas of the environment, food and health enables us to make a vital contribution to solving social challenges and improving quality of lifeThe ICLS Institute of Computational Life Sciences embraces computational science as an interdisciplinary approach to address complex challenges and develop innovative solutions in key areas of health, society, environment and nutrition. Our team of around 60 employees has extensive experience in managing interdisciplinary projects. The Neuromorphic Computing Group at ICLS develops advanced neural-network based algorithms, software libraries, and systems with the new generation of computing chips – brain-inspired neuromorphic sensing and computing hardware. We focus on perception, motion planning, and control for robotic actuators with applications in life sciences: healthcare, agriculture, food processing, and smart environments. We follow a human-centered design approach to develop new generation of physical AI systems that are power-efficient, adaptive, and safe.ZHAW is committed to gender-mixed and diverse teams in order to promote equality, diversity and innovation.What you can expectBenefitsWe offer working conditions and terms of employment commensurate with higher education institutions and actively promote personal development for staff in leadership and non-leadership positions. A detailed description of advantages and benefits can be found at Working at the ZHAW. You want to operate at the cutting edge of AI, building the strongest defenses in the AI cybersecurity market. You will be increasing the scope and quality of our defenses, and playing a pivotal role in ensuring that GenAI applications can be deployed securely at scale. You will lead the creation of cutting-edge models that not only perform exceptionally well but also operate in real-time. This involves continuously identifying edge cases for our detectors and working to collect and generate intricate threat datasets to improve the performance of these models. You will ensure that Lakera can continuously ship the best defenses in the market with a high cadence. Your passion lies in shaping the future, working on ideas that define the secure use of AI in the decades ahead. Your work will play a vital role in ensuring that AI can unleash its best potential–for good.About LakeraLakera is on a mission to secure the era of intelligent computing. We are heading towards a future where AI-powered applications take center stage. Here at Lakera, we're not just dreaming about the future; we're building the security foundation for it. We empower security teams and builders, giving them the confidence to navigate this new dynamic landscape and unleash the next phase of innovation.We work with Fortune 500 companies, startups, and foundation model providers to protect them and their users from adversarial misalignment. We are also the company behind Gandalf, the world’s most popular AI security game. If you're eager to be part of a team that's not just keeping pace but setting the pace, Lakera is the right place for you. Let's shape the future together.Example projectsExtend the scope of one of our detectors to support multiple languages without dropping performance on already supported languages. Increase the scope where our defenses perform by 100x (e.g., multi-lingual data, code, etc). Extend modeling and data generation to enable passing additional context to our prompt injection detectors, such as the LLM output and behavioral metadata. Red team our model to understand the most pressing vulnerabilities of our detectors and prioritize the data collection and generation required to fix them. What You’ll BringYou have at least 4 years of experience shipping machine learning models to production, ideally in environments where reliability and quality are key (e.g., autonomous driving, industrial applications, healthcare). Most of your experience productionizing ML models has been in unstructured data spaces such as NLP and vision. You have had experience working on end-to-end development of ML models. You have experience working on the “long tail” of data distribution, bringing models from prototypes to real-world systems. You aspire to play a pivotal role in defining the future of secure AI within a mission-driven company with ambitious goals. 👉 Let's stay connected! Follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter & Instagram to learn more about what is happening at Lakera.ℹ️ Join us on Momentum, the slack community for AI Safety and Security everything.❗To remove your information from our recruitment database, please email privacy@lakera.ai.

Cross offices/company-wide frequent events (off-site or on-line). Fun Fund to spend with the team on after-work activities. The OpportunityWe are looking for an experienced Mechanical Engineer to join our team of product developers and robot enthusiasts. We develop competitive product offerings for our customers that rely on deeply integrated and complex mechatronic systems. The team members closely collaborate with specialists from the R&D and software development group in order to evaluate, implement, test and support the product development process and the portfolio outcome. Furthermore, we are in continuous exchange with our operations group to secure the product target costs and quality standards as ONE TEAM. This renders our robots more nimble, robust and user friendly, and ensures new ways to optimize the performance and skills of our system. We are passionate about challenging and excellent hardware design and system performance at competitive costs.The ImpactAs a Mechanical Engineer in robotics, you will play a crucial role in developing and designing our future robotic systems. Your contributions will significantly impact the robustness and attractiveness of our products. With your innovative spirit and industrial experience, you will bring new ideas and approaches to the development of our robotic systems. Your professional experience with mechatronic systems makes you a key player in improving and upgrading our robotic functions, working alongside our R&D experts to strengthen our product care capabilities in a decisive way.Market & Our TechnologyANYbotics transforms industrial plants in the energy, process, and utility sector by introducing robotics to a wide range of novel applications that so far were beyond reach. Our customers are large asset operators and industrial service providers pioneering the use of robotics technology for inspection and maintenance. Our mobile robot ANYmal uses legs for extreme mobility in complex environments, camera- and LIDAR-based sensing for full autonomy and obstacle avoidance, and AI for high-quality and consistent inspection results. We develop numerous customized hardware systems, including the entire robotic platform, actuators, sensors, inspection payloads, charging systems, and all related ANYbotics mechanical hardware.Your ContributionsDesign and engineer highly integrated and complex mechatronic systems for our robot product portfolioWork on new product functionalities following a structured development processMonitor product robustness, cost and quality along the product life cyclePerform product care analysis and field inspection tasksConduct calculations for mechanical systems using FEA toolsCollaborate with the R&D and software teams on system specificationsCreate product documentation (i.e. assembly & user manuals)Your ProfileUniversity degree in engineering with a focus on mechanical engineering and/or mechatronicsMinimum of 5 years related working experience in an industrial environmentExperience in SolidWorks CAD and DM/PDM environmentHands-on engineering experience in product development, validation and testingKnowledge in design to cost and productivity optimization methodsExperienced in using DIN/ISO tolerance norms for the technical documentationExcellent communication skills in English (oral and in writing)Team player and excited to work in a high-tech companyBonus PointsExperienced in dimensioning of standard parts like motors, gearboxes and bearingsExperience in explosion proof designsKnow-how regarding the design and manufacturing of injection moulded partsExperience with electric drives and control theoryExperience in programming software (i.e. Python)

job_title: AI Start-up Founder at your own start-up (100 % remote) (m/f/d)
job_description: With unicorn founders like Paul Müller as part of the founders and team, we help outstanding talents and serial entrepreneurs build and scale their ventures.Our three founders - Daniel, Alex, and Florian - are accomplished serial entrepreneurs with a wealth of experience. EWOR's leadership team has built and exited 7 companies before, including a €1.2BN exit (Adjust), a €500 million exit (ProGlove), establishing the largest global entrepreneurship society for those under 26 (Sigma), and making more than 150 private angel investments.We invest up to €150,000 to empower multiple founders, enabling them to draw a salary and prepare for substantial funding rounds during or after our Fellowship programme. This investment is designed to support the initial stages of startup development, fostering growth and innovation.Highlighting our programme’s success, one of our fellows set a record for Europe’s largest pre-seed round by a first-time founder, securing a €12M pre-seed investment.For those who prefer a more traditional employment structure, we are open to directly employing you via a wage alternatively.TasksYou will build, and run your own start-up in fields such as AI.You will go through 20 courses ranging from team building to no-code prototyping, as well as preparing venture capital rounds.You will embark on an extensive personal development journey crafted by unicorn founders and follow a rigorous programme enhancing your goal, time, and energy management.RequirementsYou Want to Build A Start-UpYou will be the founder of a business. To succeed, you should show an entrepreneurial drive to build your business and fulfil your role as founder.You can join us with or without an ideaWe are looking for amazing entrepreneurs, not just their ideas. As part of this opportunity, you will develop the concept for your future start-up, if you do not have a clear idea yet.You Want to Learn From Outstanding FoundersBy joining EWOR, you will become part of a supportive community of exceptional peers. You will have the chance to work with unicorn founders, esteemed investors, industry experts, and global CEOs.Commitment to a Formal Agreement with EWORAs part of this unique opportunity, you will enter into a formal agreement with EWOR. This contract will outline our mutual commitments and expectations, such as time commitment and payment. The full contract can be found on our web page.BenefitsWe take you on a 6-month journey that is designed for highly driven individuals who aspire to become successful founders.We provide venture capital (up to €150,000) to enable you to draw a salary and prepare for a substantial funding round. For those who prefer a more traditional employment structure, we are open to directly employing you via a wage alternatively.We provide a network to more than 20 unicorn founders, and high-quality entrepreneurship education designed by serial entrepreneurs.This is a remote opportunity, no relocation required.For anyone eager to rapidly build a successful company, we're the perfect place to start.

WE ARE #HIRING SPECIALE Immobilien sagl nasce dalla passione per il mondo dell’accoglienza. Gestiamo ogni appartamento come se fosse la nostra casa, garantendo sempre il meglio della qualità e del comfort senza rinunciare allo stile. Ci teniamo a far sentire i nostri clienti come a casa, sia che essi siano famiglie o viaggiatori singoli, a partire da una notte fino a lunghi soggiorni di più mesi.SPECIALE Immobilien sagl è alla ricerca di una figura commerciale da inserire nel suo team dinamico e appassionato.La figura ricercata si occuperà delle seguenti attività:•            Sviluppare e lavorare alle relazioni commerciali gestendo le relative trattative con i clienti proprietari•            Fornire un servizio di assistenza al pacchetto aziendale di clienti proprietari•            Raccogliere e coordinare le molteplici e svariate richieste dei clienti proprietari •            Promuovere i servizi aziendali•            Identificare eventuali nuovi potenziali clienti proprietari nel corretto settore di mercato•            Comprendere le potenzialità dei servizi aziendali per poter al meglio lavorare ad offerte tailor made per i clienti proprietari•            Saper gestire eventuali problematiche commerciali con i clienti proprietari e salvaguardare quindi i rapporti aziendali di collaborazione Il candidato ideale è in possesso dei seguenti requisiti:•            Esperienza ed abilità nel lavoro in team•            Ottime capacità comunicative•            Autorevolezza •            Attitudine a negoziare e nella costruzione e mantenimento delle relazioni •            Orientamento al cliente e attenzione ai dettagli•            Disponibilità a lavorare ad orari prolungati, nei fine settimana e durante i periodi di maggiore affluenza stagionale (estate e inverno)•            Ottima conoscenza della lingua italiana e buona conoscenza della lingua inglese (il tedesco è un valore aggiunto)•            Patente di guida B (automunito/a) e capacità di guidare un furgone per eventuali trasporti•            Conoscenza del pacchetto office e buone capacità informatiche •            Apprezzata esperienza in un ruolo analogo o comunque in un settore a forte relazione commerciale Cosa offre Speciale Immobilien sagl:- Vitto e alloggio- Team di lavoro giovane e stimolante⁠- L'opportunità di lavorare in un ambiente dinamico, circondato dalla bellezza naturale dell’EngadinaSe desideri far parte di un ambiente di #lavoro dinamico e in crescita invia tuo #cv all'indirizzo pietro@scuolascispeciale.ch.Non vediamo l'ora di accoglierti nel nostro team!

This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  Joining Capco means joining an organisation that is committed to an inclusive working environment where you're encouraged to #BeYourselfAtWork. We celebrate individuality and recognize that diversity and inclusion, in all forms, is critical to success. It's important to us that we recruit and develop as diverse a range of talent as we can and we believe that everyone brings something different to the table - so we'd love to know what makes you different. Such differences may mean we need to make changes to our process to allow you the best possible platform to succeed, and we are happy to cater to any reasonable adjustments you may require. You will find the section to let us know of these at the bottom of your application form or you can mention it directly to your recruiter at any stage and they will be happy to help.About CapcoCapco is a global technology and business consultancy, focused on the financial services sector. You'll combine your AI skills with front-end development expertise to tackle a transformative project for a promising client.This is your chance to make a real difference!YOUR CAPCO DAY Design and implement Python applications focusing on AI, particularly Large Language Models (LLMs) and vector searching, to enhance data processing and document search capabilities.Employ innovative methods for document chunking and embedding to achieve optimal search performance and relevance.Ideally develop intuitive user interfaces using Angular or Django and manage application deployment using cloud services and DevOps tools like Terraform.Work within a cross-functional team to integrate AI technologies into applications, exploring new technologies and methodologies to enhance project outcomes.Work closely with stakeholders to understand client needs and project requirements, translating them into technical specifications and innovative solutions that leverage AI capabilities.Ensure adherence to best practices in coding, testing, and deployment, maintaining high standards of quality and security in all development activities.YOUR CAPCO FITStrong experience in writing enterprise-grade scalable Python applications, with a proven track record of delivering high-quality software solutions. Expertise in artificial intelligence, particularly in the application of large language models (LLMs) and vector search technologies, with the ability to apply these tools to solve complex data retrieval and analysis challenges.Demonstrated experience in applying different methodologies to extract, chunk, and embed unstructured data for optimal search results, showcasing a deep understanding of data processing and optimization techniques.Proficiency in frontend development using Angular or Django is considered a plus, with the ability to create engaging user interfaces that complement AI-powered applications.Familiarity with cloud infrastructure management and deployment is considered a plus.Experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow is considered a plus, indicating a foundation in ML conceptsExcellent problem-solving skills, with a creative and innovative approach to overcoming technical challenges and delivering solutions that meet client needs and project objectives.Strong communication and collaboration abilities, capable of working effectively in a team environment and interacting with clients and stakeholders to gather requirements and provide updates on project progress.Fluency in English and German.Ready to take the Next Step If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. This is an opportunity to make a difference and contribute to a highly successful company with a significant growth trajectory.
