job_title: Product Manager, Search AI, Google Cloud
job_description: Minimum QualificationsBachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.4 years of experience in product management, consulting, co-founder or related technical role.2 years of experience building and shipping technical products.Preferred QualificationsExperience in Machine Learning and building search applications.Experience managing developer-facing products (e.g., APIs, services for developers, Open Source projects, etc.).Experience in software development or engineering.About The JobAt Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing, so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development.One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud.Vertex AI Search is next generation search powered by Generative AI and powering Generative AI applications like agents, search engines, digital assistants, and more. Developers use our search and Generative AI APIs to build their own search applications or to ground Large Language Models to their data. We have recently launched grounding of Gemini on Google search and a suite of APIs to power Gen AI and search applications.Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.ResponsibilitiesWork with partner teams (e.g., Engineers, Program Managers, UX) during product design and development to implement the requirements to turn PRDs into OKRs for one or more teams.Develop and secure buy-in for a product strategy that identifies, defines, and supports the overall product narrative and direction, achieving an outcome that is greater than the sum of its parts. Validate the market size and opportunity (e.g., user-based, strategic opportunity, growth). Drive launches, maintenance, and retirement in collaboration with other cross-functional teams and stakeholders.Own some of the Search platform APIs, developing the product roadmap, while closely working with customers to understand requirements and gaps.Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google's Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.Google is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We are committed to building a workforce that is representative of the users we serve, creating a culture of belonging, and providing an equal employment opportunity regardless of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding), expecting or parents-to-be, criminal histories consistent with legal requirements, or any other basis protected by law. See also Google's EEO Policy, Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal, Belonging at Google, and How we hire.If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.Google is a global company and, in order to facilitate efficient collaboration and communication globally, English proficiency is a requirement for all roles unless stated otherwise in the job posting.To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees, or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

We are a young and dynamic startup founded in 2020 by experts who have developed a game-changing technology to bring a material with an extremely strong Pockels coefficient into a scalable silicon photonics platform. This has been a scientific and technological breakthrough, which enables the realization of advanced photonic structures and completely new applications, e.g. for photonic AI networks and quantum computing.At Lumiphase, we are bringing this new technology to market, while at the same time developing new scientific and technological concepts. This working student position is placed at the heart of our R&D activities and will ensure that our groundbreaking semiconductor chips can be tested to their full performance potential with appropriate electrical, optical and mechanical integration solutions.TasksThe position is for a student seeking a 40-60% (2–3 days/week) role to gain hands-on lab experience in an exciting and fast-growing industrial startup. The purpose of this role is to support our R&D team with a range of hands-on tasks, includingmechanical design,PCB design,electrical and optical asssembly of silicon chips,soldering and installation of hardware components and samples into test chambers,selection and ordering of hardware components,running calibration routines and performing measurements.You will closely collaborate with R&D engineers, gaining insights into electrical and optical testing hardware, test methods, and practical lab skills related to semiconductor components.RequirementsWe are looking for a candidate with strong interest in electrical engineering and micro-scale photonics and desire to contribute within a dynamic deep-tech startup.Desired qualifications:Strong interest in hands-on work with delicate semiconductor components/wafers and electrical and optical measurement equipmentExperience in using CAD and/or PCB design software; basic mechanical and/or electrical engineering knowledge is an advantagePython knowledgeIndependent and exact working styleGood command of English (German is a small plus but not a requirement)The position is well suited for students pursuing an engineering, natural science or computer science degree at a university or a university of applied sciences (Fachhochschule). It may also be fitted as an industrial internship for an engineering student of Bachelor/Master program.Start and duration of the position can be aligned with your availability and/or your university’s regulations, with a preference for a minimum of 6 months.

Die freedos IT GmbH ist ein junges, agiles und innovatives IT-Unternehmen aus Baden-Württemberg und bietet individuelle IT-Dienstleistungen wie Business-Consulting, Security und Entwicklung aus einer Hand. Wir begleiten IT-Projekte unserer Kunden von der Analyse und Planung über die Realisierung bis hin zur Komplettbetreuung.Du entwickelst mit unserem Team maßgeschneiderte Softwarelösungen für unsere Kunden und erweiterst dabei auch unsere internen, selbst entwickelten Frameworks. Weiter hilfst Du uns dabei die Codecoverage zu erhöhen, deployment Pipelines zu erstellen und unterstützt bei der Analyse sowie der Behebung von Störungen im IT-Betrieb unserer Kunden. Dabei begegnen dir umfangreiche IT-Infrastrukturen mit den nachfolgenden Schwerpunkten.AufgabenWir suchen jemanden wie Dich, wenn Du Fachkenntnisse in nachfolgenden Bereichen und erste Berufserfahrung mitbringst:Du unterstützt unser Entwicklungsteam bei der Programmierung von individuellen Softwarelösungen in der .NET-WeltDabei arbeitest du hauptsächlich mit Visual Studio 2022, VS Code und Datenbank-Managementsystemen (EF Core 7 / 8)Das DevOps-Tool unserer Wahl ist GitlabDie Softwarelösungen basieren zum großen Teil auf .NET 7 / 8 und Blazor, einigen MVC-Projekten, Cross-Platform-Apps mit Xamarin für iOS/Android oder sogar Winforms wirst du jedoch auch begegnenDokumentation, Tests und mitdenken ist natürlich ebenfalls ein ThemaDafür gibt’s auch Unterstützung durch AI wie Copilot und einem netten Team 😊Zusätzlich wünschen wir uns Folgendes:Erfahrungen als SoftwareentwicklerErfahrungen im Projektmanagementein hohes Maß an Zuverlässigkeiteine Vorliebe für genaues und gründliches Arbeiten undeine Portion Teamgeist und KommunikationsstärkeQualifikationMindestens ein Jahr BerufserfahrungC#.Net 7 / 8Entity Framework CoreBlazorHTMLCSSTeamgeist und KommunikationsstärkeProjektmanagementBenefitsFlexibles ArbeitenWeiterbildungBetriebliche AltersvorsorgeJobradÖPNV ZuschussTeameventsSoftgertränkeVitamineKaffeeWerde Teil des Teams und gestalte mit. Wir freuen uns auf dich!

At SwissBorg, our mission is to build a spectrum of investment experiences that help people redefine wealth. Our app has over 790,000+ verified users, offering the best price and liquidity across 16 fiat currencies to buy 90+ cryptocurrencies. Users can earn yield, diversify their portfolios with our themed crypto bundles, and gain access to exclusive alpha investment opportunities. Our community is rapidly expanding, with more than $1.4 billion in assets held in the app and over 51,000 premium users.Join us in shaping the future of finance, pushing the boundaries of what's possible, and transforming the way people manage their wealth. Whether you’re in Austria or Taiwan, and whether your portfolio is worth one dollar or a million, SwissBorg provides the best tools to learn about digital currencies and manage your wealth effectively.Join the team to help revolutionise the world together!We are seeking a proactive Business Development Specialist with a strong background in web3/crypto and finance. This transversal role will involve working across multiple areas, reporting directly to the Business Development Manager. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in business development or sales roles, with a focus on attracting and negotiating with crypto projects for token listing and fund-raising initiatives as well as partnering with KOLs and medias.It is required for the candidate to be fluent in both German and English and to reside in either in Berlin or ZurichWhat you might be doing:Relationship Management: Develop and maintain strong relationships with key opinion leaders (KOLs) and expand our network across Europe. Leverage any existing network to benefit SwissBorg’s strategic goalsToken Listings: Identify, meet, and attract projects to list their tokens on the SwissBorg app. Lead negotiations and proactively seek solutions to ensure successful listingsFundraising Collaboration: Engage with crypto projects that are raising funds, promoting our flagship product, Alpha. Help projects attract long-term investors who are committed to their success while providing our users with attractive investment opportunitiesStrategic Growth: Contribute to the strategic growth of SwissBorg by identifying and pursuing new business opportunities within the web3 and financial sectors. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, product development, and customer support, to ensure alignment and drive business objectivesMarket Analysis: proactively identify and share trends, emerging opportunities, and competitive landscape within the web3 and finance industriesReporting: Provide regular reports and updates to management on business development activities, progress, and resultsWhat you might bring:Experience: Minimum of 3-5 years in a business development or sales role. Previous experience in web3/blockchain is a mustIndustry Knowledge: Deep understanding of blockchain technology, decentralised finance (DeFi), and the broader cryptocurrency ecosystemSales Acumen: Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets and driving business growthNetworking Skills: Strong ability to build and maintain relationships with a diverse range of stakeholders, including an existing network of industry contactsAnalytical Mindset: Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and make informed business decisions.- Emotional Intelligence: High emotional intelligence with strong relationship management skillsCommunication: Exceptional verbal and written communication skills in German and English, with the ability to present ideas clearly and persuasivelyEducation: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics, or a related field. Advanced degree (MBA) is a plusPassion: Genuine interest in the future of finance and the role of web3 in transforming traditional financial systemsWhy you should apply:  Freedom to build the company of your dreams Learn with (super cool) experts in finance, engineering, AI, psychology and business BORG bonus based on our meritocratic system Flexible working hours 25 working days of vacation + local holidays We'll provide you with a MacBook and a cutting edge tech stack to help you do your best work Annual company and team retreats - We'd love to see you at the next one! Continuous learning and development opportunitiesIf our job description speaks to you, but you don’t feel like you meet 100% of the requirements, apply anyway! You may have skills we didn’t even know we needed.At SwissBorg, we embrace diversity. We strongly believe that getting the best outcome requires different perspectives and backgrounds. We’re committed to openness, curiosity and creating an inclusive culture because we know that diverse teams build better products and generate better ideas. We strongly encourage applications from everyone!Familiarising yourself with our product is crucial for anyone looking to join our team. Please make sure to test the app, explore our blog for the latest developments, and follow our Careers Page, LinkedIn, and X for regular company updates!

Title: Technical Engagement ManagerType: Permanent contractLocation: Switzerland (Lausanne or Zurich)About UsAt Visium, we enable enterprise executives in defining their AI & Data strategy, execute large scale transformations and implement AI across operations, ensuring their organization becomes future-proof.With expertise in strategy, architecture, cloud engineering, analytics, artificial intelligence and machine learning, we empower our clients to unleash and scale the power of their data.We're on a mission to pioneer a bright future and build future-proof and ethical organizations . Join the curious, the ambitious, the doers, the good-hearted, the ones who build a world we're all in awe of - our Visumees.Ready to become one?RoleAs an Engagement Manager, you will:Ensure outstanding delivery:Lead by example and support the teams you work withOversee the development of impactful AI solutions and deliver outcomes that meet the clients' needContribute to the development of the structure, content and direction of the engagement strategy Focus on stakeholder management, including building client care and team leadershipOvercome any obstacle necessary to unlock true business benefits and ROI for our clientsActively creating and continually monitor and measure the delivery of value based client benefits throughout the engagement (ROI)Take responsibility for driving and implementing corrective actions on delivery challenges and make tactical decisions to deliver a value-based solutionBe commercially aware and manage the delivery of engagements against project milestones, financial performance, utilization and performance against internal KPIsOwn our clients relationship:Interact with our clients to cultivate strong partnerships, pinpoint fresh avenues for value creation, and formulate innovative initiatives aimed at enhancing client valuePlay a part in fostering a diverse portfolio of clients, developing relationships with key individuals, and assisting in the conceptualization of potential offerings for new clientsCarry revenue quota of managed revenues based on the collaboration assignedStart developing an a diverse network of external contactsRequirementsWhat we are looking forRequired qualifications:Data Science, ML or Computer Science background is required for this positionA solid track record of building strong client relationships with large organizations, as well as identifying opportunities to deepen those relationships and grow the business. Extensive ability of dealing with C-Level stakeholdersFluent in English and at least, French or GermanThe profile we're looking for:Combination of strong strategic and analytical abilitiesStrong problem-solving skills and ability to handle complex issues; demonstrates creative thinkingAbility to work effectively with people at all levels in an organizationSelf-starter: eager to break new ground, create opportunities for othersAbility to deliver formal presentations to management, influencing and convincing themBenefitsWhat we offerA competitive compensation packageA yearly education budget to steep your learning curveA yearly sport budget because a fit body leads to a fit mindA flexible working culture because your work-life balance matters to usA position that enables you to have an impact on 1'000s of people, and the whole company's growthAn international, knowledgeable, and passionate team with a strong collaborative mindsetCheck our LinkedIn and website to learn more about us & don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions.

About YouYou want to use your skills to address climate change. You’d be excited to work in a dynamic, friendly, fast-growing startup. You’re a midweight-senior researcher with at least five years’ experience, some of it in a B2B SaaS environment, and you welcome the responsibility of shaping the direction of a pre-seed startup product. Sounds like you? Read on…About UsOptiml is fast-growing startup with a mission to decarbonise real estate as “the trusted software provider for sustainable and profitable real estate portfolios”. We spun out of ETH Zurich in fall 2022 and raised our $1.6m pre-seed from top-notch US & EU funds: Innovation Endeavors (San Francisco – fund of former Google CEO Eric Schmidt) and Planet A (Berlin). In short: although we’re only 18 months old we’re getting a lot of interest, and we’re at the stage where we need a dedicated researcher to shape the future of our product.Our product is B2B SaaS software, providing analytics and advice to guide our users’ organizations towards more sustainable outcomes. Our problem space sits at the intersection of complex systems, analytics, optimisation guidance and human decision-making. To be successful, we need to clearly and insightfully present complicated information to users, in a way that they can act on… and this is where we need your help!TasksThis role works with both our Product/Design and Business teamsCollaborate with colleagues across the organization to develop a better understanding of users’ needs and experiences.Support the development of outstanding product experiences, and a go-to-market strategy that enables Optiml to succeed with customers.Identify user needs, product requirements and take part in translating them into storyboards, user journeys, wireframes, low and high-fidelity mockups, and prototypesContinuous discovery and iteration to improve the user experience including running experiments with product analyticsHelp guide the end-to-end product design process for the lifecycle of products and features, from user research, to conceptualization, to launch, to product iterationCommunicate findings to stakeholders, in order to influence decision-making based on understanding of the user and customer experience.Instill understanding of users across the Optiml team, ensuring that all colleagues feel engaged and inspired.RequirementsMust have5+ years’ experience in UX research, ideally including some experience in a SaaS environment, working with data visualization, and / or a startup.Bachelor's or Master's degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Sociology, Information Science, or other relevant field.You are capable and self-sufficient across a range of methodologies, particularly user interviews, usability testing, surveys and the analysis of product / marketing analytics.You can identify what research is needed, run projects (including participant recruitment), bring colleagues on the journey and distill what you’ve learned into meaningful, actionable findings and recommendations.You’re focused above all on the impact your research can have, not just the process. You have the judgment to know when to prioritize scrappy over rigorous, and vice versa.You can devise, lead and execute on research ops, including participant recruitment / panels, remote research tools (e.g. Hotjar) and data storage.You have worked on complex B2B user journeys, ideally in an enterprise domain.Strong written and verbal communication skills in English and German.Swiss or EU citizenship (unfortunately due to size, we can’t support non-EU… yet).Advantageous to haveExperience of working on leading-edge analytics products.Experience of market and/or marketing research.Familiarity with the building / real estate industry.Experience working with generative AI and / or LLMs.Content design and writing skills.French language.Who We Are Looking ForYou’re motivated by our mission, and passionate about the work you’d be doing.You’re not scared of hard problems. On the contrary, you welcome the challenge of becoming immersed in a complicated domain, where the problems you’ll be solving really matter.You are a do-er. You have a humble attitude, a proactive approach, an eagerness to help your colleagues, and a desire to do whatever it takes to make the team succeed.You are flexible. While your primary role is as a researcher, the nature of working at a dynamic startup is that you could be working on many adjacent tasks from one day to the next, from marketing to design to strategy to product management.BenefitsDirect impact on the product and go-to-market direction of Optiml from the earliest daysAttractive stock options package as reward for being an early joiner.We work primarily from our Zürich office, but offer the possibility of some remote work and flexible hours.Shit happens: 100% accident non-occupational accident insurance (UVG) covered.Flexible parental leave.Learning and development budget of CHF 1k (conferences, certificates, etc.).

Typewise (Y Combinator S22) is a Swiss-American deep tech startup on a mission to make daily lives easier by decoding human thoughts. We’re building an AI Communication Assistant to increase productivity of enterprise customer service and sales teams. Our clients include Fortune 500 companies across Europe and the US.We have two products: a browser extension that empowers employees to answer emails and chats faster and a smartphone keyboard for consumers. We use our proprietary AI technology that we develop together with the world-leading ETH Zurich Institute’s AI Center.We’re looking for a Product Designer (40%, remote work possible) for our mobile app “Typewise Keyboard” which has more than 2.5 million downloads already and won the CES Innovation Award two times. You’ll take ownership of the product, keep track of usage metrics and identify customer needs through data analysis and user research, and work closely with our CTO and engineering team. Also, you’ll develop new feature ideas and follow the latest market trends.Why work for TypewiseWe’re a 20+ People, Passionate, International Team Based In Zurich, Lisbon, Amsterdam, Belgrade, And Beyond. Our Company Is Remote First And We Thrive On a Fast-paced, Fast-growing, Flexible Environment With Flat Hierarchy And Individual OwnershipYou will have the chance to make a significant impact on the development of a fresh, innovative and growing product with global potential to reach millions of peopleWe employ short decision-making processes, and we use a lean and agile approach to developmentWe organize quarterly physical meet-ups in awesome locations (paid for by the company)We allow flexible hours and calendar year with lean structureWe offer competitive salariesWhat you will doYou’ll design innovative features for the Typewise KeyboardYou’ll delve into user needs, pain points, and limitations through rigorous research to continuously refine our KeyboardYou’ll collect insights from our dedicated Telegram community and feedback platforms, collaborating closely with the Community ManagerYou’ll lead the sprint plannings of the Keyboard teamYou’ll work closely with our iOS, two Android developers and App Tester and lead the Keyboard sprint planningTogether with the CTO you’ll define the roadmapWhat you will bring2+ years of experience designing mobile apps for complex applications at a startup or in a fast-paced environmentEfficient communicator with experience working with cross-functional teams including software engineersAbility to conduct user testing and knowledge of user research methodsProficiency in Figma, or comparable prototyping toolsExcellent planning and organization skillsTeam player with strong facilitation capabilities and a can-do attitudeAbility to crack a joke (in Swiss German or any language of choice)Bonus Points ForScrum Master certificateExperience in leading a product teamExcited? Say hello!If you want to be part of an innovative and awesome startup team, and bring your own ideas to life for millions of users, say hello and send us your CV and portfolio.

The OpportunityWe are looking for an experienced Mechanical Engineer to join our team of product developers and robot enthusiasts. We develop competitive product offerings for our customers that rely on deeply integrated and complex mechatronic systems. The team members closely collaborate with specialists from the R&D and software development group in order to evaluate, implement, test and support the product development process and the portfolio outcome. Furthermore, we are in continuous exchange with our operations group to secure the product target costs and quality standards as ONE TEAM. This renders our robots more nimble, robust and user friendly, and ensures new ways to optimize the performance and skills of our system. We are passionate about challenging and excellent hardware design and system performance at competitive costs.The ImpactAs a Mechanical Engineer in robotics, you will play a crucial role in developing and designing our future robotic systems. Your contributions will significantly impact the robustness and attractiveness of our products. With your innovative spirit and industrial experience, you will bring new ideas and approaches to the development of our robotic systems. Your professional experience with mechatronic systems makes you a key player in improving and upgrading our robotic functions, working alongside our R&D experts to strengthen our product care capabilities in a decisive way.Market & Our TechnologyANYbotics transforms industrial plants in the energy, process, and utility sector by introducing robotics to a wide range of novel applications that so far were beyond reach. Our customers are large asset operators and industrial service providers pioneering the use of robotics technology for inspection and maintenance. Our mobile robot ANYmal uses legs for extreme mobility in complex environments, camera- and LIDAR-based sensing for full autonomy and obstacle avoidance, and AI for high-quality and consistent inspection results. We develop numerous customized hardware systems, including the entire robotic platform, actuators, sensors, inspection payloads, charging systems, and all related ANYbotics mechanical hardware.Your ContributionsDesign and engineer highly integrated and complex mechatronic systems for our robot product portfolioWork on new product functionalities following a structured development processMonitor product robustness, cost and quality along the product life cyclePerform product care analysis and field inspection tasksConduct calculations for mechanical systems using FEA toolsCollaborate with the R&D and software teams on system specificationsCreate product documentation (i.e. assembly & user manuals)Your ProfileUniversity degree in engineering with a focus on mechanical engineering and/or mechatronicsMinimum of 5 years related working experience in an industrial environmentExperience in SolidWorks CAD and DM/PDM environmentHands-on engineering experience in product development, validation and testingKnowledge in design to cost and productivity optimization methodsExperienced in using DIN/ISO tolerance norms for the technical documentationExcellent communication skills in English (oral and in writing)Team player and excited to work in a high-tech companyBonus PointsExperienced in dimensioning of standard parts like motors, gearboxes and bearingsExperience in explosion proof designsKnow-how regarding the design and manufacturing of injection moulded partsExperience with electric drives and control theoryExperience in programming software (i.e. Python)

SWISS-REV SA, Fintech Svizzera attiva nel campo dell'Asset Management, ricerca un profilo da inserire nel Team per la sua sede di Morbio Inferiore.Le principali mansioni e responsabilità riguarderanno:gestione e/o supporto della Clientela (banche, fondi d'investimento e società di gestione indipendenti)responsabile di progetti ad-hoc e dei rapporti con gli stakeholder coinvolti (Clienti, sviluppatori IT, testing team)analisi funzionale a fine di sviluppi Software (sviluppo nuovi tools, adeguamenti normativi e fiscali, bug-fix)Requisiti chiave della funzione:formazione economico-finanziariaesperienza di almeno 2/3 anni nel campo dell' Asset Managementconoscenza del funzionamento dei mercati finanziariconoscenze approfondite degli strumenti finanziari base e complessi (derivati)ottima capacità di utilizzo di Excelottima conoscenza della lingua inglese parlata e scrittaflessibilità, motivazione, multitaskingattitudine alla comunicazione e ai rapporti interpersonaliSi offre contratto di lavoro a tempo indeterminato, ambiente di lavoro serio e dinamico, con significative possibilità di crescita per chi è in grado di distinguersi.Se in linea con i requisiti ed interessati ad approfondire questa opportunità, saremo lieti di ricevere la vostra candidatura completa di CV

job_title: traduttrice/traduttore presso il Servizio linguistico italofono
job_description: La Segreteria generale (SG-DEFR) cerca per il 1° dicembre o per data da convenire una / untraduttrice/traduttore presso il Servizio linguistico italofono50%-50% / BernaIl Servizio linguistico della SG-DEFR cerca una traduttrice o un traduttore per integrare un team motivato e dinamico di 10 persone. Le tipologie di testi spaziano su tutte le tematiche di competenza del Dipartimento, dal mondo del lavoro alla formazione professionale, dall'economia alla ricerca e innovazione, dal servizio civile al turismo.Le Sue mansioniTradurre varie tipologie di testi in presa diretta con l'attualità (comunicati stampa, legislazione, rapporti del Consiglio federale, pagine internet, discorsi ecc.) Rivedere testi redatti o tradotti in italiano, anche da collaboratori freelancePartecipare a progetti di terminologiaLavorare con il tool di traduzione assistita (Transit)Il Suo profiloTitolo universitario (master in traduzione) o equivalenteOttime doti redazionali e proprietà di linguaggioMotivazione, senso critico, attenzione ai dettagli e spirito di gruppo Completano il profilo puntualità, affidabilità e buona cultura generalePerfetta padronanza di due lingue ufficiali e ottima conoscenza passiva della terza nonché dell'ingleseInformazioni complementariPer maggiori informazioni rivolgersi a Stefano Fiore, capo del SLI (tel. 058 46 49140; stefano.fiore@gs-wbf.admin.ch).Si prega di candidarsi tramite il nostro sistema di gestione delle candidature. A tal fine, cliccare su "Per candidarsi". Inviare le candidature in lingua italiana.Numero di riferimento: JRQ$540-10907Chi siamoIl Servizio linguistico italofono (SLI) della Segreteria generale del Dipartimento federale dell'economia, della formazione e della ricerca (DEFR) è il centro di competenza responsabile delle traduzioni dal tedesco e dal francese in italiano per il DEFR. Coordina inoltre i lavori di traduzione su temi dipartimentali trattati dalla Cancelleria federale o condivisi con altri dipartimenti.L'Amministrazione federale è attenta alle necessità e ai diversi vissuti dei suoi collaboratori e ne apprezza la diversità. La parità di trattamento gode della massima priorità.

job_title: Head of Data Analytics and Innovation
job_description: Job DescriptionThe Head of Data Analytics, and Innovation is a strategic leadership role within Sandoz’s Technology organization, responsible for steering all facets of data management, analytics, and reporting to align with and support business objectives, while driving innovation in data-driven decision-making processes. The ideal candidate will act as a catalyst for change, steering our innovation greenhouse—a dynamic and collaborative environment where cutting-edge ideas are cultivated and nurtured into transformative business solutionsMajor Accountabilities: Drive Strategic Transformation:Develop and execute a comprehensive Data, Analytics and Innovation strategy that aligns with the organization's business goals.Partner with Business to build data-driven products and insights that support decision-making and drive business outcomes.Collaborate with key stakeholders to ensure successful architectural design, support development, and delivery of analytics products.Architect The Future:Lead the implementation of modern Data, Analytics, and AI platforms, including the selection and integration of relevant toolsets.Construct data architecture using modern tools to convert business needs into data and system requirements.Develop and implement enterprise data governance processes, ensuring data accuracy, security, and compliance.Drive data architecture for agile and iterative implementations across systems and platforms, ensuring alignment with security requirements and business needs.Champion Innovation Greenhouse:Establish strategic partnerships and frameworks that extend innovation beyond daily operations, enhancing our competitive edge and business agility while ensuring projects align with strategic goals and deliver substantial ROI.Drive innovation within the digital analytics function by exploring new analytics techniques and technologies, including leveraging AI and Machine Learning.Establish data architecture frameworks and standards to support scalable and efficient data management.Leadership And Development:Lead, mentor, and develop a high-performing technology team.Plan talent development initiatives to equip the team with necessary skills.Risk Management And Compliance Adherence:Develop and enforce a comprehensive risk management strategy to identify, assess, and mitigate risks across technology platforms and business operations, ensuring proactive risk resolution.Ensure compliance with all legal, regulatory, and industry standards across technology solutions, updating and maintaining protocols to adapt to new regulations.Major AccountabilitiesDrive Strategic Transformation: Conduct regular strategic reviews of the data and analytics platforms to ensure they align with the changing business environment and continue to support decision-making effectively.Provide ongoing training and support to business units on the effective use of data-driven products and insights to enhance business outcomes.Architect The Future:Oversee the design and implementation of scalable data architectures and business intelligence interfaces that facilitate robust data management and analytics capabilities.Manage the creation and maintenance of back-end data structures to drive enterprise reporting and ensure they integrate seamlessly with business intelligence platforms.Implement and manage ETL routines that enforce Sandoz’s business rules, ensuring data integrity and compliance with governance frameworks.Regularly update and optimize IT processes to align with the latest technological advancements and data governance standards.Champion Innovation Greenhouse:Lead cross-technology efforts to identify and pilot advanced analytical methods and AI use cases that could increase profit margins and improve operational efficiency.Foster an environment that supports innovative ideation and execution, allowing the organization to explore and implement cutting-edge data solutions beyond conventional business processes.Leadership And Development:Implement talent development programs to build essential skills.Foster a culture of collaboration, innovation, and accountability.Optimize Cost Management Regularly review the Technology budget, adjusting forecasts and allocations to respond to changing organizational needs and market conditions. Risk Management And Compliance Adherence:Conduct regular risk assessments to identify vulnerabilities and develop strategies to mitigate identified risks in technology projects and operations.Review and revise compliance protocols regularly to ensure ongoing adherence to changing legal and regulatory requirements.Minimum Requirements: Work Experience: 15+ years of experience in digital & data analytics, with a strong background in cloud-based platforms.Proven track record in developing and implementing digital analytics strategies and platforms.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business needs into data and system requirements.Excellent leadership, communication, and collaboration skills.Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.Strategic mindset with the ability to think analytically and drive business results through data-driven insights.Strong leadership and team-building skills, with a passion for developing talent and fostering a collaborative team culture.Proven ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and drive change and innovation.Skills: Business Partnering.Communication Skills.Cyber Security.Influencing Skills.Information Security Risk Management.IT Governance.Stakeholder Management.Strategic Leadership.Talent Development.Why Sandoz?Generic and Biosimilar medicines are the backbone of the global medicines industry. Sandoz, a leader in this sector, touched the lives of almost 500 million patients last year and while we are proud of this achievement, we have an ambition to do more!With investments in new development capabilities, state-of-the-art production sites, new acquisitions, and partnerships, we have the opportunity to shape the future of Sandoz and help more patients gain access to low-cost, high-quality medicines, sustainably.Our momentum and entrepreneurial spirit is powered by an open, collaborative culture driven by our talented and ambitious colleagues, who, in return for applying their skills experience an agile and collegiate environment with impactful, flexible-hybrid careers, where diversity is welcomed and where personal growth is encouraged!The future is ours to shape!Commitment to Diversity & InclusionWe are committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.Join our Sandoz Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to hear more about Sandoz and our career opportunities, join the Network here: Sandoz Talentpool (novartis.com)#Sandoz

Who are we?From your everyday PowerPoint presentations to Hollywood movies, AI will transform the way we create and consume content.Today, people want to watch and listen, not read — both at home and at work. If you’re reading this and nodding, check out our brand video .Despite the clear preference for video, communication and knowledge sharing in the business environment are still dominated by text, largely because high-quality video production remains complex and challenging to scale—until now….Meet SynthesiaWe're on a mission to make video easy for everyone. Born in an AI lab, our AI video communications platform simplifies the entire video production process, making it easy for everyone, regardless of skill level, to create, collaborate, and share high-quality videos. Whether it's for delivering essential training to employees and customers or marketing products and services, Synthesia enables large organizations to communicate and share knowledge through video quickly and efficiently. We’re trusted by leading brands such as Heineken, Zoom, Xerox, McDonald’s and more. Read stories from happy customers and what 1,200+ people say on G2 .In 2023, we were one of 7 European companies to reach unicorn status. In February 2024, G2 named us as the fastest growing company in the world. We’ve raised over $150M in funding from top-tier investors, including Accel, Nvidia, Kleiner Perkins, Google and top founders and operators including Stripe, Datadog, Miro, Webflow, and Facebook.About The RoleYou will join a team of 40+ Researchers and Engineers within the R&D Department working on cutting edge challenges in the Generative AI space, with a focus on creating highly realistic, emotional and life-like Synthetic humans through text-to-video. Within the team you’ll have the opportunity to work with different research teams and squads across multiple areas led by our Director of Science, Prof. Vittorio Ferrari, and directly impact our solutions that are used worldwide by over 55,000 businesses.If you have seen the full ML lifecycle from ideation through implementation, testing and release, and you have a passion for large data, large model training and building solutions with clean code, this is your chance. This is an opportunity to work for a company that is impacting businesses at a rapid pace across the globe.What will you be doing?ResponsibilitiesIn this position, you'll have the opportunity to join different research squads solving challenging problems in building a foundational model to represent humans in video. You will be responsible for designing and implementing high quality solutions for deployment. This would include:Research and develop solutions for audio / video data generation of humans in videoDesign methods and tools for data processing to create pre-training and fine-tuning data-setsInvestigate and propose new tools and infrastructure to accelerate the development of state-of-the-art modelsDesign and run experiments to evaluate model outcomes for model training on our large scale compute cluster (petabyte scale data, multi-node, multi-GPU model training)Deliver production-ready solutions for deployment in our data and model training pipelinesTake ownership of the engineering developments necessary to ship new AI models into productCommunicate and collaborate across London, Amsterdam, Munich and Zurich research officesWho are you?We are looking for strong engineers with an audio/video background, and experience in data processing for pre-training and fine-tuning, ideally in large model development for generative AI.Excellent coding skills and experience in Python and PyTorch, engineering excellence is your missionSome research experience in audio / video analysis or generative AI (Text, Speech, Video)Track record in developing ML models and solutions from concept to delivering business impactExperience working as part of a highly productive development team, following and developing best practices (maintaining existing code, versioning, conducting code reviews etc.).MSc or PhD in computer science, computer vision or related fieldExcellent verbal and written communication skills.The good stuff...For this specific position we can consider remote-first within EuropeAttractive compensation (salary + stock options + bonus)Hybrid work setting with an office in ZurichCycle to work salary sacrifice scheme to commute to the office25 days of annual leave + public holidaysWork in a great company culture with the option to join regular planning and socials at our hubs, and company retreatsA generous referral scheme when you know people that are amazing for usStrong opportunities for your career growthYou can see more about Who we are and How we work here: https://www.synthesia.io/careers

job_title: Startup Founder (MUC/BER, September 2024) - Data Scientists/Analysts/ML engineers
job_description: Please note that the job location is 100% on-site in Munich or Berlin. We listed it in Zurich to also welcome the brightest minds from here!Note: This ad is not for a job, but rather for the opportunity to build your own VC-backed startup!🚀 Data Scientist: Launch Your Startup Journey with Antler! 🚀Are you a data scientist with excellent programming skills, and experience in building complex algorithms? Do you have a knack for solving complex problems and a passion for pioneering cutting-edge tech solutions? If you're ready to unleash your talents and build a disruptive tech venture, we want to connect with you!🎯 We're looking for exceptional individuals who:Excel in Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI, with a knack for advancing technology.Can unearth insights from intricate data, leading in ML methodologies.Embrace the challenge of merging diverse data for revolutionary models.Are adept at prototyping innovative solutions that pave the way for real-world applications.Navigate product development with strategic foresight and precision.💡 If this resonates with you, your founder's journey awaits!! 🌐 Who We Are:Antler is one of the most active early-stage VC firms on the planet, providing funding from pre-seed to Series C. We invest in Founders who seek to define our tomorrow and reshape the world we live in with groundbreaking technological innovation. Every year, we handpick the strongest Founders from more than 135,000 applicants across our 28 locations on the globe, which has led us to work with more than 7,000 founders to date and a portfolio of more than 1,000 startups.📅 The Antler Program:🗓️ 12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off September 2024, in vibrant Berlin or Munich.🤝 Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow visionaries to find your co-founder(s).💡 Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a pre-seed investment of €100k for 10% equity.🚀 Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success!🧭 Our application processEmbark on a straightforward 2-3 week journey:Apply via our website.Participate in the Intro & Drive Interview.Proceed to a detailed interview with our partners.Potential Offer💰 Compensation: While you’re not getting paid during the program, there is a promising potential pre-seed investment to kickstart your startup journey waiting for you!(Please note: We don't offer visa sponsorship for this opportunity.)🌍Diversity & Inclusion:At Antler, we take diversity and inclusion seriously. It's not just a trend, it is a core part of our organizational DNA. We foster an environment that encourages inclusivity, recognising the innovative solutions that diverse perspectives bring. Our data substantiates our commitment - 30% of our ventures are co-founded by women, and our founder pool represents over 120 distinct nationalities.Why dream when you can build? Grab this opportunity and craft your own tech legacy with Antler.🌟🚀🌐

With a rich research history at ETH Zurich, marked by state-of-the-art publications, we are pushing the boundaries of artificial intelligence in the real world. We are seeking a Senior AI Engineer to spearhead the expansion of our engineering team. industry or research experience (PhD counts), demonstrating a strong foundation in practical applications, demonstrating a track record of successful AI developmentsDeep technical expertise in semantic scene understanding, neural network architectures, robot decision-making, supervised learning, self-supervised learning, etcStrong understanding of foundational AI models, with the ability to 4 U ConsultingIl Gruppo Geberit è leader sul mercato europeo dei prodotti sanitari. Geberit è presente nella maggior parte dei Paesi europei e, grazie alla struttura integrata e a una forte presenza locale, può offrire un valore aggiunto unico, sia nel campo dell'ingegneria sanitaria sia nel campo della ceramica da bagno. Geberit è presente nel mondo con 26 impianti di produzione. Il Gruppo ha sede a Rapperswill-Jona, in Svizzera. Con circa 11.000 dipendenti in quasi 50 Paesi, nel 2023 ha registrato un fatturato netto di circa 3 miliardi di franchi svizzeri. Comunicazione, Progettazione, Post-vendita, Etc.), Svolgerà Attività Di Supporto Tecnico e Gestionale Per Tutte Le Linee Di Prodotto Per Diventare Co-responsabile Del Successo Dei Prodotti Nel Mercato Di Riferimento. MansioniSupportare il Product Manager nella gestione dei prodotti di competenzaAggiornare e gestire le informazioni tecniche e commerciali e i dati relativi ai prodottiVerificare la completezza di gamma delle diverse Linee di ProdottoSupportare la preparazione del lancio di nuovi prodottiCorreggere i contenuti negli strumenti di marketing (fisici e digitali) a supporto della commercializzazione dei prodottiSupportare la preparazione e la realizzazione di eventi e fiereGestire le richieste tecniche e commerciali di clienti interni ed esterniSupportare la gestione dei singoli reclami relativi alla qualità dei prodottiSupportare le decisioni di pricingSupportare la collaborazione con i reparti del Gruppo e rappresentare gli interessi del mercato Italia rispetto al Product Management del GruppoSupportare il monitoraggio della concorrenzaSEDE DI LAVOROMannoINFORMAZIONI AGGIUNTIVESi offre un contratto di lavoro svizzero full-time a tempo indeterminato. job_title: Software Engineer, Computer Vision - Reality Labs
job_description: Reality Labs at Meta is building products that make it easier for people to connect with the ones they love most, enjoy top-notch, wire-free VR, and push the future of computing platforms. We are a team of world-class experts developing and shipping products at the intersection of hardware, software and content.As Computer Vision Software Engineer on the Reality Labs team at Meta, you can help build new, innovative hardware and software that radically redefine the way people work, play and connect. What we build today could one day be the norm. So to be here today is to truly be at the heart of change and the frontier of what's to come. We're the people helping to define the metaverse. We may not have all the answers. But together, we're getting closer.Meta is seeking AI Software Engineers to join our Research & Development teams. The ideal candidate will have industry experience working on computer vision related topics. The position will involve taking these skills and applying them to solve for some of the most crucial & exciting problems that exist on the web. We are hiring in multiple locations.Software Engineer, Computer Vision - Reality Labs Responsibilities:Apply relevant AI and machine learning techniques to build intelligent rich visual systems that improve Meta's products and experiencesAssist in goal setting related to project impact, AI system design, and ML excellenceDrive large efforts across multiple teamsMentor other AI Engineers & improve the quality of AI work in the broader teamDevelop custom/novel architectures, define use cases, and develop methodology & benchmarks to evaluate different approachesApply in-depth knowledge of how the machine learning system interacts with the other systems around itMinimum Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience.Experience in one or more of the following areas: Deep Learning, Computer Vision, AR/VR, 3D Vision, Robotics, Machine Learning or artificial intelligenceExperience developing computer vision algorithms or computer vision infrastructure in C/C++ or PythonPreferred Qualifications:Experience with distributed systems or on-device algorithm developmentExperience in deep learning and PyTorchExperience contributing to AI PublicationsAbout Meta:Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Wir bieten Beratung, die Strategie mit Technologie vereint und verbinden Unternehmertum mit Innovationsgeist. Bei uns warten auf Dich aussergewöhnliche Entwicklungschancen, vielfältige Gestaltungsräume und Kollegen, die schnell zu Freunden werden.Consulting. Solutions. Ventures.Als Senior Consultant/Manager im Data & Analytics / Artificial Intelligence Team bist du verantwortlich für die fachliche und strategische Weiterentwicklung unserer Data Analytics Projekte. Aufbau von langfristigen Kundenbeziehungen und Förderung von Partnerschaften.Projektmanagement und Datenanalyse: Leitung von Teams bei der Konzeption, Validierung und Umsetzung von Analytics Projekten in verschiedenen Branchen. Überwachung des Projekterfolgs und Erfüllung von Kundenanforderungen.Digitale Transformation und Machine Learning: Aktive Mitarbeit und Unterstützung bei digitalen AI-Transformationen, einschliesslich Datenintegrationsstrategien, Aufbau von Datenökosystemen und Implementierung von AI-Betriebsmodellen. Entwickeln, anwenden und validieren von Machine Learning Modellen mit den neuesten Technologien.Datenwertschöpfung und Präsentation: Gestalten der Datenwertschöpfungskette, von der Datenstrategieentwicklung über Datenqualität und -integration bis zur Entwicklung fortschrittlicher ML/DL-Modelle. Erstellung von aussagekräftigen Dashboards und Benutzeroberflächen für Kunden. Interpretation und Präsentation von Analyseergebnisse auf eine verständliche und geschäftsrelevante Weise.QualifikationErfolgreicher Abschluss eines Masterstudiums der Fachrichtung Data Science, (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Mathematik, Physik oder einer vergleichbaren AusbildungMehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einem Beratungs- oder IndustrieumfeldErfahrung mit Data Science Toolkits und Frameworks (z.B. scikit-learn, Spark ML, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch) als auch Visualisierungstools (z.B. Tableau, PowerBI)Versierter Umgang mit Analytics Sprachen (Python R)Statistische und mathematische Fähigkeiten um komplexe Analysemodelle aufzusetzen, zu validieren und zu operationalisierenVerhandlungssichere Englischkenntnisse sowie gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift. Nr. 043 299 7314 zur Verfügung.

Future Computing & AI Systems ResearcherLeading technology company looking to add experienced researchers in the area of computing systems to their growing team in Zurich.The role will focus on conducting fundamental research on new directions in computing systems.Key Roles and Responsibilities:Develop academic research partnerships with top universitiesAchieve new breakthroughs in research and innovationProduce and present research papers at leading conferences and eventsProduce white papers on current developments and future directions on computing systemsKey Skills and Experiences Required:PhD in Computing Systems or relevant field / equivalent research experience in industryRecord of publishing research papers in the area of computing systemsResearch experience and a familiarity with at least one of the following areas:AI AcceleratorsMassively Parallel Heterogeneous AI SuperClustersAI Software FrameworksNew Compiler Technologies and MLIRLarge Language ModelsParallel and Distributed Programming ModelsHigh Performance InterconnectsHardware SecurityGraph Computing and HPC SystemsBy applying to this role you understand that we may collect your personal data and store and process it on our systems. For more information please see our Privacy Notice (https://eu-recruit.com/about-us/privacy-notice/)

Are you excited about working at the forefront of applied research in an industry setting? Thomson Reuters Labs in Zug is seeking scientists with a passion for solving problems using state-of-the-art information retrieval, natural language processing and generative AI.What does Thomson Reuters Labs do? We experiment, we build, we deliver. We support the organization and our customers through applied research in informational retrieval and natural language processing. We work closely with product and domain experts to identify compelling solutions at the intersection of user need and technical feasibility.About The RoleAs a Senior Applied Scientist, you will:Experiment and Develop: You will drive the end-to-end model development lifecycle, championing best practices to ensure reproducible research and well-managed software delivery. Collaborate: Working on a collaborative cross-functional team, you will share information, value diverse ideas, and partner effectively with colleagues across the globe. You will elevate and mentor teammates. Deliver: With a sense of urgency and the desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, you will translate complex business problems into projects with clearly defined scope. Our problems are complex; our solutions are right-sized. You will be accountable for timely, well-managed deliverables. Innovate: You will be empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will foster innovative ideas to solve real-world challenges. Inspire: You will be a proactive communicator who is excited to share your work. You will be articulate and compelling in describing ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences. You will help lead the way in the adoption of AI across the enterprise. About YouYou’re a fit for the role of Sr Applied Scientist with a focus on NLP and IR if your background includes:Basic QualificationsPhD in a relevant discipline or Master with a comparable level of experienceAt least 5 years practical, relevant experience building NLP/IR/ML systems, from ideation to productionSolid software engineering skills for prototypingProfessional experience as a technical leader, translating complex business problems into projects with clearly defined scope, coordinating and guiding the work of othersPreferred Qualifications8 years practical experience building IR, ML or NLP systems in academia or industry Demonstrated ability to translate cutting edge research into working prototypes and experience experimenting with novel IR or NLP models to solve real-world problemsExperience in fast-paced, agile environments managing uncertainty and ambiguity;Outstanding communication and data-driven decision-making collaboration with Product and Business Stakeholders.Proficiency in Python, Java, or Scala and experience delivering minimum viable products in large enterprise environmentsPublications at relevant venues such as ACL, EMNLP, NAACL, NeurIPS, ICLR, SIGIR, KDD or similar What's in it for you?You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:Technology: Our Scientists and Engineers get to play with big data sets to discover new products, capabilities, and insights for our customers. We have over 60,000 TBs worth of legal, regulatory, news, and tax data. Hybrid Work Model: We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected. Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: global minimum parental leave, two company-wide Mental Health Days Off; work from another location for up to a total of 8 weeks in a year, 4 of those weeks can be out of the country and the remaining in the country, Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more. Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; enterprise-wide company learning days, internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking. Social Impact: Ten employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact. Purpose-Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world. DISCLAIMER The above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.Accessibility As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

job_title: AI Consultant - Technology Consulting - International Development
job_description: At EY, you will have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we are counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.The opportunityWe are currently looking for a highly talented Technology Consulting professional (Consultant level) with a strong understanding of Machine learning & Artificial Intelligence to join our Geneva-based International Development team.This is a unique opportunity to leverage your Machine learning & Artificial Intelligence experience to make an impact on the world by working for some of the most impactful organizations in International Development sector, which includes the UN and major NGOs.Your Key ResponsibilitiesSupport the design and implementation of the latest Machine learning & Artificial Intelligence technology solutions suited to client needs, and the engagement of project phases and activities throughout the entire project lifecycle.Facilitate discussions with main stakeholders to help them define their needs and translate them into Project requirements.Cooperate with local and international colleagues across EY. Contribute to the development of the International Development Practice by supporting client proposals, internal initiatives, and recruiting activities.Skills And Attributes For SuccessA master’s degree with a strong academic record of achievement2 to 5 years of experience implementing Machine learning & Artificial Intelligence projects.Advanced knowledge of business use cases that Machine learning & Artificial Intelligence solves for, and knowledge of Artificial Intelligence Governance.Good understanding of Business Information ecosystems, integrations and interfaces; understanding of digital technologiesExcellent communication, teamwork, and problem-solving skills; strong work ethic, growth mindset, and drive for resultsFull professional proficiency in English; good knowledge of French is an advantage; any other language is considered a plus.Preferred: Relevant certifications: Data Science / Machine learning / Artificial Intelligence / functional areas, Project Management methodologies, Agile processesWhat We OfferEY Switzerland offers you to work in a diverse and inclusive environment with around 3,000 employees from 64 different countries. You will collaborate with the best, learn from the best and continually grow, as we invest a significant portion of our annual turnover in the personal development and training of our employees.Click here to find out more about our benefits and corporate social responsibility.Have we sparked your interest? We look forward to receiving your complete application with CV, cover letter and certificates.For more information, please contact our recruitment team (recruitment.switzerland@ey.com / +41 58 286 33 66).The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.EY | Building a better working worldEY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people, and society and build trust in the capital markets.Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform, and operate.Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax, and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

At Smeetz, we are dedicated to revolutionizing the way visitor attractions manage their sales and optimize their revenue. As a unified commerce Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) platform powered by AI, we provide attractions such as theme parks, museums, and theaters with an all-in-one solution to effectively manage, market, and price their products.We are a fast-growing SaaS startup, and we're looking for an Account Manager to join our dynamic team. This role is a great opportunity to contribute to a growing company, work with a tight-knit team, and help shape our account management operations.To be successful in this role, you should have hands-on experience with tech B2B customers and have a creative and resilient mindset to be able to turn customer problems into solutions.The key responsibility of the Account Manager is to handle projects from A to Z, whether during the onboarding phase or any project development at a later stage in the life of the customer. Responsibilities Onboard new customers / Project managementOrganise kick-off meetings with new customersOwn the product roadmap and collaborate with the product team to deliver custom developments on timeManage onboarding sessions and training materialKeep customers engaged and respect project deadlinesVisit customers at their location for the sales launch Nurture the relationship with active customersOrganise Executive Business Reviews every 6 months with tier-I customersDo regular check-in calls with all customersAnalyse customers' performance to identify product misuse and upselling opportunities Implement new features smoothlyMonitor subscriptions renewals and contract expiries Be a product ambassadorPartner closely with other cross-functional teams to translate business needs and product requirements into new solutions for customersStay updated on the latest product developmentsRequirementsMandatory requirementsExcellent command of German and English (French is an asset) Tech-savvy and 2+ years of experience as an account manager or project manager for a B2B Saas Strong communication skillsTravelling is required to visit customers / visit Smeetz locations (average of 30%)Work permit in Switzerland or Swiss citizenship RequirementsExperience working with HubSpot and JiraPrevious experience at a tech scale-up company is highly preferred Previous experience with project management is highly preferred You have "glass is half full" mindset, approaching challenges and opportunities with optimism and a solution-oriented perspectiveYou have the ability of building strong relationships with clients and understanding their unique business requirements. Your ability to establish trust and rapport with customers is crucial for success in this roleYou are a dynamic and proactive professional who takes initiative and thrives in a fast-paced startup environment. You are able to work autonomously while also contributing to successful teamwork and collaborationYou are highly stress-resistant and have the ability to handle pressureYou have a higher education degreeBenefitsYou will have the opportunity to take part in a fast growing scale-up, make a difference and manage your time and prioritiesYou will work in a highly performance-driven environmentYou will be part of team building activitiesWe encourage personal development in an environment based on trustYour successes will be recognized and rewarded with increased earning potential and ownership responsibilitiesThrough this position, you will have the opportunity to grow in an international environmentIf you're looking to join a scale-up where you can make a significant impact, we'd love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter detailing why you believe you're the right fit for this role.

Located near Basel, Switzerland, Parashift employs about 40 people in the field of Machine Learning Engineering and Development.
