SQL, MongoDB) vorweisenDu kennst die gängigen Standardbibliotheken zur Datenvisualisierung und -aufbereitungEin stark ausgeprägtes analytisches Denkvermögen, Neugier, eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe sowie eine hohe soziale Kompetenz zeichnen dich ausVerhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse runden dein Profil abDAS ERWARTET DICH!Impact. Du hast die Chance, echten Einfluss auf unsere Customer-Journey zu nehmen und dabei deine eigenen Stärken und Ideen einzubringen.Challenges. Die Möglichkeit, in einem dynamischen Startup jeden Tag neuen Challenges gegenüberzustehen und etwas Neues zu Lernen .Teamspirit. Wir punkten mit kurzen Entscheidungswegen und einem engagierten Team, das Wissen teilt und gemeinsam an spannenden Projekten arbeitet.How We Work. Home Office oder in Präsenz? Bei Wahl des Ortes und der Arbeitszeiteinteilung entscheidest du.Culture. Neben regelmäßigen Teamevents, Teamlunches, gemeinsamen Aktivitäten, gibt es auch mal die ein oder andere Herausforderung an unserer Konsole.Über unsBei pacemaker.ai arbeiten wir mit Leidenschaft und Ehrgeiz an AI-basierten Lösungen, die es ermöglichen datengestützt die bestmögliche Entscheidung für eine nachhaltige Supply Chain zu treffen.

Design. Progress. Together.CureVac Corporate Services GmbH, a wholly owned subsidiary of CureVac SE, combines the central functions of the CureVac business group. CureVac is a global biopharmaceutical company in the field of mRNA technology, with more than 20 years of expertise in researching, developing and optimizing the versatile biological molecule for medical purposes. Our focus is on prophylactic vaccines, innovative cancer immunotherapies, and protein-based therapies. All RNA people are striving to achieve our main joint goal: To bring multiple best-in-class mRNA medicines to market.To strengthen our team in Tübingen, Wiesbaden or Amsterdam, we are currently looking to recruit aData Scientist (f/m/d)Your Responsibilities Translate business needs into data analytics/reporting requirements to support decisions and workflows with required information across CureVac’s value chain with specific focus topics in the area of R&D/Clinical or Manufacturing/Supply Chain  Apply advanced statistical analysis and predictive modeling techniques to analyze datasets  Develop and evaluate statistics and cutting-edge machine learning algorithms & models to make data analysis more efficient  Perform large-scale experimentation to identify hidden relationships, trends, and patterns between variables in large datasets  Create compelling data visualizations and reports that communicate complex findings and recommendations to non-technical stakeholders, facilitating informed decision-making  Share knowledge, best practices, and insights in a growing data analytics community at CureVac Your Qualifications University degree in computer science, data science, statistics or a related field, or an equivalent qualification  Experience in solving data analytics challenges in the Life Science area  High proficiency in statistical analysis, predictive modeling, machine learning algorithms, and data mining techniques  Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, R, SQL, and ideally experience with MS-Azure-based data science capabilities (e.g., Synapse, Azure ML, Databricks) and visualization (e.g., Power BI, Plotly)  Ability to work in diverse, cross-functional teams in a dynamic business environment based on agile development principles  Strong communication skills, also to non-technical audiences, to guide and inspire  Willingness to understand use cases to be enabled by data analytics  Fluency in English, German is a plus We offer you a challenging and varied opportunity with an innovative and dynamic company that is expanding.With much passion and sense of responsibility, we work together on the medical revolution. We pride ourselves on maintaining an honest and trusting relationship with each other which is characterized by openness to new ideas and continuous progress. Mutual respect, reliability and personal initiative are self-evident for us.Design your future with us – become part of the RNA people!We look forward to receiving your application via our CareerPortal.CureVac Corporate Services GmbHHuman ResourcesZehra BlumeFriedrich-Miescher-Straße 1572076 Tübingenwww.curevac.com

About BeamBeam is a tech start-up leveraging Generative AI and NLP to build AI Agents for business operations. Beam's generative agents help organisations to boost their productivity by automating repetitive tasks in seconds. Powered by LLMs, AI agents are easy to setup, seamlessly integrate with business applications and support teams where they need them most. We are on a mission to transform business practices by empowering organisations with artificial intelligence to increase efficiency, improve competitiveness, and scale operations globally.To learn more about us, please visit our website at https://www.beam.ai/About The RoleAs an AI Engineer at Beam, you will play a pivotal part in the development and maintenance of our Beam AI product, ensuring its scalability, reliability, and performance. In this role, you will be responsible for developing our AI platform, implementing automation algorithms, and optimising cloud resources to support the seamless deployment and operation of our AI Agents. We are looking for someone who is passionate about building great products, has strong leadership skills, and is comfortable working in a fast-paced, startup environment.ResponsibilitiesThis position requires a blend of technical expertise in cloud computing, artificial intelligence, and DevOps practices. Your key responsibilities will entail the following:Design, implement, and maintain scalable cloud infrastructure to support AI applications and servicesCollaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI models into cloud-based platformsDevelop automation algorithms and toolsOptimize algorithms for performance, cost, and scalabilityEnsure security and compliance standards are met throughout the AI development lifecycleTroubleshoot and resolve infrastructure issues in a timely mannerStay updated with emerging technologies and industry best practices in AI, cloud computing, and DevOpsRequirementsBachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related fieldMinimum 6 years of proven experience in cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud PlatformStrong foundation in building NLP/NLU and LLM ApplicationsProficiency in containerisation technologies such as Docker and container orchestration platforms like KubernetesExperience with infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform or PulumiProficiency in programming languages such as Python or GolangFamiliarity with DevOps practices and tools (e.g., CI/CD pipelines, Git, Jenkins)Familiarity with AI/ML frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learnStrong problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot complex issuesExcellent communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teamsAbility to work independently and take ownership of projectsSelf-motivated and detail-oriented, with a passion for techIf you are passionate about leveraging AI to drive innovation and thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment, we'd love to hear from you! Join us in shaping the future of AI-powered solutions!

Your missionOur Machine Learning & Data Science department is on a mission to enhance the way our customers use the Neoshare platform by harnessing the power of AI.We are looking forward to welcoming a Machine Learning Engineer to the team.TasksYou will be responsible for the development of machine learning systems. You will collaborate with the development team in processing, analyzing, and preparing data for model development. You will train and evaluate machine learning models using various algorithms and techniques. You will ensure that machine learning models are integrated into the product infrastructure and put into production. You will be responsible for the use of machine learning models in the production environment. Your profileYou have a degree in computer science or a comparable education and have already gained relevant professional experience in the development and use of machine learning models in a production environment. You have a good understanding of machine learning basics (training, validation, evaluation). You have knowledge of Tensorflow or Pytorch. You have experience with Natural Language Processing / Information Retrieval. You have already gained experience with Docker, Kubernetes / Docker Compose, and large language models (LLM). You are no stranger to data drift, model registry, or rendezvous architecture. You have good programming skills in Python. You work independently and solution-oriented and are interested in current technologies. You are fluent in German and English - we work in an international team. Why us?Flat Hierarchies: We foster a culture of "Du" (informal "you") – encouraging equal communication! Events: Engage in regular after-work events, Tuesday breakfasts, Christmas parties, premium-catered hackathons, and shared cooking sessions – strengthening team spirit! neoshare-health: Enjoy team yoga, sports and leisure activities, and daily fresh fruits and vegetables – promoting fitness and health! Equipment: Our employees work with state-of-the-art technology in modern offices – creating an ideal working environment! Flexible Working Hours: Manage your workday autonomously. Job ticket: Benefit from a 50% employer subsidy for the Deutschlandticket. Remote-First: While our beautiful Munich office is always open, you can work remotely for most of your hours. Colleagues eagerly anticipate your presence on Tuesdays for an office day. If you are interested in the position, we are happy to receive your application in English.About UsWe are an international fintech company with offices in Munich, Offenbach am Main, Düsseldorf and Sofia (Bulgaria). We develop and operate a software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform and process solution for the implementation & management of large loans and investments! Our products neoshare immo, banking, leasing and corporate create a revolutionary digital ecosystem.

Mit unserer Energiesparlösung und deren Weiterentwicklung wollen wir weiterwachsen und so unseren Beitrag zur Energiewende leisten. Als Machine Learning Engineer (gn) bei vilisto spielst du eine entscheidende Rolle bei der Revolutionierung der Energieeffizienz. Dein Fachwissen bei der Wartung und Verbesserung unserer Anwesenheitssmodelle trägt direkt zu unserer Mission bei, intelligente, bedarfsorientierte Heizungslösungen anzubieten. Arbeite mit uns an Innovationen und leiste einen wichtigen Beitrag zum nachhaltigen Leben.Was du bei uns machstDu wartest Software für einen reibungslosen Betrieb von mehr als hunderttausend ML-ModellinstanzenDu verbesserst Modelle zur Erkennung und Vorhersage von Belegung auf der Grundlage von IoT-SensordatenDu implementierst Datenerfassungspipelines zur Überwachung und Verbesserung von ModellenDu entwirfst gemeinsam mit deinen Kollegen Schnittstellen, Prozesse und Visualisierungen, um die Modelle erklärbar zu halten und die manuelle Wartung so weit wie möglich zu automatisierenRequirementsWas du mitbringstBachelor-Abschluss oder höher in Informatik, Mathematik oder einem verwandten Fachgebiet oder vergleichbare BerufserfahrungUmfassende Backend-Erfahrung (Microservices, Web-Frameworks, Datenbanken, Monitoring, Containerisierung)Solide Erfahrung im Umgang mit Daten, einschließlich Statistik, maschinellem Lernen und DatenverarbeitungstechnikenEin Verständnis von Automatisierungstechnologien, Data Engineering und MLOps ist ein großes PlusIdealerweise kannst du in einem funktionsübergreifenden Team arbeiten, um Benutzeroberflächen zu entwerfen, die Modelle des maschinellen Lernens für ein breites Spektrum von Benutzern erklärbar und nutzbar machenDu kommunizierst in Englisch, Deutsch ist ein PlusDu setzt dich leidenschaftlich für die Rettung des Klimas auf diesem Planeten einBenefitsWas wir dir bietenEinen Job mit Sinn - Gemeinsam arbeiten wir an unserer Vision, eine Welt zu schaffen, in der alle Menschen achtsam mit ihrer Umwelt umgehen und durch Innovationen nur so viel Energie verbrauchen, wie sie für ihr Wohlbefinden benötigenEin hoch motiviertes Team - In unseren quartalsweisen Teamevents erlebst du, dass wir auch außerhalb des Büros viel Spaß zusammen haben, unser Summercamp ist unser HighlightGrüne Mobilität ist uns wichtig - Aus diesem Grund erhalten bei uns alle Mitarbeitenden das DeutschlandticketWir unterstützen dich und deine Familie - Zur Unterstützung der Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf übernehmen wir die Hälfte deiner KiTa-Kosten bis zu 100€ monatlich pro KindProduktivität und Erholung gehen Hand in Hand - Wir bieten 30 Tage bezahlten UrlaubGet the job done - Bei der Frage nach dem Wann und Wo lassen wir dir viel Freiraum und bieten flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle in Voll- und Teilzeit sowie die Möglichkeit, bis zu 50 % remote zu arbeitenWir fördern deine Aktivität - Durch unsere Kooperation mit Wellpass hast du deutschlandweit für nur knapp 18€ monatlich Zugang zu über 7.500 Partnern aus dem Sport- und WellnessnetzwerkWir bei vilisto freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen jeglicher Geschlechtsidentität, Nationalität, ethnischer Zugehörigkeit, sozialen Hintergründen, religiöser Überzeugungen, körperlichen und geistigen Fähigkeiten, Altersgruppen sowie sexuellen Orientierungen.check(event) ; career-website-detail-template-2 => apply(record.id,meta)" mousedown="lyte-button => check(event)" final-style="background-color:#99CC33;border-color:#99CC33;color:white;" final-class="lyte-button lyteBackgroundColorBtn lyteSuccess" lyte-rendered="">

About The CompanyWe are an early-stage (Seed secured) Crypto AI startup that aims to monetize scientific research, datasets and other kinds of IP through marketplaces tailored to AI companies that seek to acquire quality data for training. Our platform offers ways to participate in the AI economy without compromising the data, keeping it private (hence PrivateAI). All our co-founders have previously founded and exited multiple crypto unicorns ($AGIX, $SYS, $DOGE, $FTM)About The RoleThe target of the knowledge graph system we are building is prediction of existence of hidden links between different entities within scientific texts, i.e.revealing the dependencies not mentioned in the text explicitly.You will be developing AI models for the following tasks:Extracting knowledge graphs from a scientific article uploaded by a scientific group;Extracting knowledge graphs from a preliminary encrypted scientific article;Analysis and defining the regularities of the raw data by a user request;Finding the list of available knowledge graphs for a particular user request in a form of word, phrase or sentence (analysis);Associating the knowledge graph database with a list of corresponding articles in storage to further provide it as a response for a user search request.Requirements‍Strong proficiency in Python and R, Mistral, SpaCy and BERT, cyBERT, FAISS, SpaCy LLMDeep understanding of machine learning, including frameworks like TensorFlow, Keras, and PyTorch.Expertise in natural language processing (NLP) and data analysis.Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau and PowerBI.Familiarity with big data technologies such as Hadoop and Spark.Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases.Understanding of web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript).Excellent project management and team leadership skills.Preferred‍Background in scientific research data management.Experience with blockchain technology and cryptocurrencies.Experience with HELib, Microsoft SEAL, PALISADE, OpenFHE, TFHE, HEAAN, Λ ○ λ, lattigo

Hey there! 👋Are you an ambitious Lead Machine Learning engineer? Do you want to use your data science and engineering skills to help fast-growing tech scale-ups by means of ML? Furthermore, are you ready for the adventure of expanding Enjins together with our ambitious team? Then keep reading!Why? 🤔At Enjins we want to make Machine Learning solutions that are here to stay. Our mission is to become the go-to ML engineering company in the world of tech scale-ups. for both talent and customers.How? 🚀We are driven by impact, and so is our vision on Machine Learning. We don't want a data scientists' laptop to be a graveyard for brilliant models. That's why we created an approach that allows us to actually implement Machine Learning that realises business value. This approach demands our ML engineers to stand out in engineering, data science and consulting skills.What? [You'll be doing] 👀As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll work within our growing Machine Learning team, comprising of 15 other equally amazing Machine Learning Engineers.In this role, there is plenty of room for your ideas. Our team is growing fast and we'll support your growth ambitions as much as possible. We're flexible, and as long as you're proactive and take responsibility for your own work, we'll be a great match!Some of the responsibilities [but not limited to;]You will lead the ML Engineering team together with the other Lead ML EngineersYou work in small teams on ML projects and take responsibility for maximum impact at our customers. You're customer-facing and manage a growing set of accountsYou apply your machine learning, engineering and business knowledge and guide others to learn more. You are not afraid of new (technological) challenges. After all, our world is changing continuously!You are ready for more responsibility to carry our company forward! We will involve you in the important business decisions (team, customers, innovation) and give you more responsibilities along the wayWithin 1 month you'll:Finish the Enjins ML Engineering onboarding program, in which you will understand how Enjins work, be trained in our approach and become a certified cloud practitioner in AWS/Azure or GCPStart your first customer project!Within 3 months you'll:Develop and implement robust ML applications for your client, working on building new solutions and ironing out any old integration problems. This way laying the foundation of your ML engineering skillsLead the ML team to new heights and bring your experience to solve any development issuesHad multiple feedback moments with your project team before and after client meetings, to help you to improve your consulting and project management skillsWithin 6 months you'll:You'll identify new tools / methods / processes that work bestHave hired additional ML Engineers to join your growing Enjins' ML teamHave helped your client move along rapidly - their velocity has increased significantlyRequirementsMinimum Qualifications:🚶‍♀️You have a relevant background with respect to Machine Learning Engineering and a minimum of 3 years of relevant working experienceYou are not afraid to connect with our clients on board level (CTO, CFO, CIO, etc) to achieve maximum resultsYou have experience with cloud infrastructure and data engineeringYou have experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), networking, ETL/ELT-tools and understand the basic concepts of MLOpsYou are fluent in English and are eligible to work in BerlinPreferred Qualifications: 🏃‍♀️You have experience with machine learning and know how to create ML models and bring them to productionYou consider yourself ambitious, responsible, pragmaticBenefitsWhat to expect from us: ⚡️We look for people that want to enjoy the ride of a start-up and benefit from the freedom in the role:A young, close and ambitious team of ML engineersDiverse and challenging projects and clients in Berlin, read more about it here!A dedicated training program to improve your technical skillsOther knowledge sharing sessions ranging from project discussions to (room for) learning on the job1-on-1 coach for your personal growth and developmentAn office in BerlinAnd last but not least, lots of fun! We promise!Have we spiked your interest? 🌎Let's have a talk! In the first meeting you talk directly to one of our Lead ML engineers, so ask everything you want to know. If you want to reach out to us before applying with any questions, drop us an email at work@enjins.com

job_title: Machine Learning Engineer / AI Engineer (w/m/x) in Climate Tech Startup
job_description: Deine AufgabenIn einer Zeit, in der der Klimawandel eine der größten Herausforderungen darstellt, ist die Transformation der Energiesysteme entscheidend. Die Fernwärme steht im Zentrum unserer Bemühungen, da hier immer noch über 80% der Wärme aus fossilen Energien stammt. Wärmenetze sind besonders in Ballungsgebieten und Bestandsgebäuden eine wichtige Alternative zur Wärmepumpe und bieten ein enormes Potenzial, Emissionen beim Heizen unserer Städte einzusparen. Wir haben uns als Ziel gesetzt, Versorger entlang der Wertschöpfungskette eines Wärmenetzes zu begleiten, um eine kosteneffiziente und schnelle Fernwärmewende zu ermöglichen.Deshalb haben wir 2021 das Startup Zentur.io GmbH mit dem Ziel gegründet, die Fernwärmewende aktiv mitzugestalten und mit unserer Produktlösung, der District Heating AI, maßgeblich voranzutreiben. Als Teil von Zentur.io übernimmst du eine zentrale Rolle bei der Transformation traditioneller Fernwärmenetze. So tragen wir aktiv zu einer digitalen, kundenzentrierten und grünen Wärmeversorgung unserer Städte bei. Bei uns wirst du umfangreiche Erfahrungen im Bereich der Energiewirtschaft, Produktentwicklung und Unternehmensgründung sammeln können. Uns ist die Unternehmenskultur sehr wichtig, daher stehen wir für Transparenz, Offenheit in der Kommunikation sowie tiefes Vertrauen und ein bodenständiges Auftreten. Werde Teil von Zentur.io und sei auf unserer spannenden Phase des Wachstums an Bord.Zur Unterstützung unseres Tech Teams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine:n Machine Learning Engineer / AI Engineer (w/m/x). Interesse geweckt?Entwicklung und Implementierung von Machine Learning-Modellen zur Lösung komplexer Anwendungsfälle im Fernwärmebereich.Aufbau und Wartung von Machine Learning-Pipelines zur Automatisierung von Arbeitsabläufen.Analyse großer Datensätze zur Identifizierung von Mustern und Trends.Zusammenarbeit mit Datenwissenschaftlern, Ingenieuren und Produktmanagern zur Integration von ML-Lösungen in unsere Produkte.Durchführung von Tests und Validierungen der ML-Modelle zur Sicherstellung ihrer Genauigkeit und Zuverlässigkeit.Dein ProfilBachelor- oder Master-Abschluss in Informatik, Data Science, Maschinenbau oder verwandten Bereichen.Umfangreiche Erfahrung in der Modellierung und Implementierung von Machine Learning-Algorithmen.Kenntnisse in Programmiersprachen wie Python.Erfahrung mit ML-Frameworks wie TensorFlow, PyTorch oder CUDAVerständnis von Datenbanken und Datenverarbeitungstechniken.Ausgezeichnete analytische und Problemlösungsfähigkeiten.Gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch, Englisch von Vorteil.Warum wir?Die Möglichkeit, aktiv an dem Erfolg unserer Vision und Strategie mitzugestaltenFlexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit, remote zu arbeitenKarriereorientierte MitarbeiterentwicklungEin ansprechendes Vergütungsmodell und 30 Tage UrlaubMöglichkeit einer Mitarbeiter:innenbeteiligung (VSOP)Eine offene und junge Arbeitsatmosphärein einem StartupRegelmäßige Teamevents und gemeinsame AktivitätenDu stehst Herausforderungen offen gegenüber und bist bereit für eine steile Lernkurve?Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung, inklusive deiner Gehaltsvorstellung.Wir haben den Traumjob den du suchst, erfüllst aber nicht die 100%?Kein Problem - gerne arbeiten wir gemeinsam an den fehlenden Prozenten.Über unsDie Zentur.io GmbH ist ein Software-as-a-Service-Anbieter aus Landshut und unterstützt Fernwärmenetzbetreiber bei der Digitalisierung der Zähler, optimalen Betriebsführung der Netze und Transformation der Erzeugung hin zu erneuerbaren Energien. Zentur.io wendet sich mit seinen Lösungen an private Energieversorger und öffentliche Unternehmen, die Fernwärmenetze betreiben – aber auf diesem Gebiet kein oder kaum IT-Know-how oder freie Ressourcen haben. Ziel von Zentur.io ist es, die Fernwärmeversorgung digitaler, kundenzentrierter und grüner zu machen und die Fernwärmewende zu beschleunigen. Weitere Informationen unter: www.zentur.io

Wir sind Studenten die eine Gastronomie Management Plattform aufbauen. Dafür brauchen wir Unterstützung.AufgabenDas könnten Deine Aufgaben sein:Analyse und Auswertung von DatenErstellung von PrognosenEntwicklung von AlgorithmenEntwickeln von benutzerfreundlichen responsiven WebanwendungenEinbindung von externen API´s und SchnittstellenEinbringungen von Ideen und kreative LösungsansätzeQualifikationMögliche Qualifikationen als Data Scientist:in:Erfahrung mit Python/RErfahrung mit DatenbankenSpaß an der Entwicklung von Algorithmen für Prognosen oder AuswertungenBenefitsDas bieten wir Dir:lockere Start-up AtmosphäreDynamisches Team - Du profitierst von der Dynamik eines jungen TeamsErfahrung im Aufbau eines Start-upsVon Anfang an dabei zu sein

Als Data Scientist (m/w/d/-) bei formigas bist du Teil unserer co_labs und arbeitest mit Daten aus unterschiedlichsten Branchen. Du explorierst fortschrittliche Algorithmen und baust erste Prototypen, insbesondere in den Bereichen Machine Learning, Computer Vision und Natural Language Processing.Wir sind formigas, ein Studio für digitale Innovation aus Konstanz am Bodensee. Wir helfen Unternehmen, den technologischen Wandel zu gestalten und die Kontrolle über ihre Zukunft zu übernehmen. Für unsere Kunden arbeiten wir mit herausfordernden Technologien wie Computer Vision, AI und Robotics in der frühen Phase von digitalen Innovationsprojekten.Wie du uns als Data Scientist unterstützen kannstMit deiner mehrjährigen Erfahrung im Bereich zwischen Data Science und Data Engineering evaluierst du in unseren co_labs in Form von Prototypen, welcher algorithmische Ansatz zu den Daten und Use Cases unserer Kunden passt. Dabei bedienst du dich an deiner Expertise in den Bereichen Machine Learning, Computer Vision und Natural Language Processing.Du fühlst dich auch außerhalb von Jupyter Notebooks wohl und kannst deine Modelle und Algorithmen mit Software Developers, Experience Designers und Innovation Strategists in ein Produkt integrieren.Du kannst dich für andere Themen und Technologien begeistern und bist bereit dich in Neues einzuarbeiten? Du hast Kenntnisse in weiteren Themengebieten wie z. B. Embedded Systems oder Sensorik? Umso besser! Du baust unsere interne AI Community mit auf und prägst diesen wachsenden Bereich in unserer Crew maßgeblich mit.Was noch wichtig istFür unsere Projekte, brauchst du diesen oder einen ähnlichen Tech Stack: Python, Scikit-learn, pandas und NumPy, Tensorflow oder PyTorch.Unsere Unternehmenssprache ist Deutsch, daher brauchst du sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse (C1). Und da wir aber hin und wieder doch mal ins Englisch switchen, brauchst du auch gute Englischkenntnisse.Was bedeutet es, mit uns zu arbeitenTransparency, Care, Trust, Continuous Improvement – unsere vier Grundwerte, die jede unserer Entscheidungen beeinflussen.Transparency bedeutet, … Die Aussage „über Geld spricht man nicht" finden wir altbacken. Bei uns kennt jede:r Crewie alle Zahlen und alle Gehälter. Wir bieten dir ein wirklich transparentes Vergütungsmodell, das nicht nur dein aktuelles Marktgehalt, sondern auch deine persönliche Situation und Selbsteinschätzung berücksichtigt. Als Data Scientist (w/m/d/-) bieten wir dir ein Jahresbruttogehalt in Höhe von 55k - 73k €. Dein individuelles Grundgehalt errechnen wir gemeinsam mit dir gleich zu Beginn des Bewerbungsprozesses.Care bedeutet, … Wir kümmern uns um einander und berücksichtigen „das echte Leben" und somit dich in allen Lebenssituationen. Ob mit einer Aufstockung zum Kindergeld oder Entlastung z.B. bei der Pflege von Angehörigen. Bei uns gibt es kein Konkurrenzdenken, keine Schuldzuweisungen, wenig Bullshit und deine Wochenenden gehören dir. Unsere Crewies sind keine „Human Resources", sondern der Kern unserer DNA!Trust bedeutet, … Wir haben keine Kernarbeitszeiten und keine strikte Urlaubsregelungen. Deine Arbeitszeiten und deine 30 Tage Urlaub sprichst du direkt mit deinem Team ab. Du hast eine längere Reise geplant? Mit etwas Vorlaufzeit und unbezahltem Urlaub kein Problem! Du entscheidest, wo du arbeiten möchtest: Ob von Zuhause, von unserem Shared T-8.space oder im Sommer vom Boot.Continuous Improvement bedeutet, … Wir experimentieren, scheitern oder gewinnen – und am Ende: wachsen wir. Damit das kontinuierlich passiert, darfst du 20% deiner Arbeitszeit dafür nutzen, um dich persönlich und fachlich weiterzuentwickeln. Dabei lassen wir dich nicht allein, sondern unterstützen dich mit Peer Feedback, Coaching, neuesten Gadgets und Technologien innerhalb unseres future_labs, sowie internen und externen Weiterbildungsformaten, … you name it!Für uns völlig normal, trotzdem wollen wir nicht vergessen sie zu erwähnen – unsere Essentials: Protoyping-Werkstatt mit 3D-Drucker & Laser, Siebträgermaschine, fritz-kola, Thomas Henry, froobie-Eis, frisches Obst direkt aus der Region, voll ausgestattete Küche & Bad, Essensgutscheine, eine Sonnenterrasse, Kicker … und haben wir schon die 3 Fußminuten bis zu See erwähnt?Challenge AcceptedDas klingt für dich nach der perfekten nächsten Herausforderung? Super, dann schick uns am besten gleich deinen CV und ein paar Worte zu dir. Auf das klassische Anschreiben kannst du gerne verzichten.

Looking for a data science position? My client is a specialist Fintech company seeking ambitious and agile data scientists to solve challenging machine learning and big data platforms globally. Overview of the role -As a member of the Data Science and Machine Learning (AI/ML) team, you will address real-world problems such as dynamic pricing, real-time customer intent prediction, optimizing search result rankings for lifetime value, classifying and deriving insights from unstructured data (images and text).In This Role, You’ll Get to:Design, code, experiment with, and implement models and algorithms to enhance customer experience, supply side value, business outcomes, and infrastructure readiness.Analyze vast datasets, including hundreds of millions of customers and more than 600 million daily user-generated events, to discover actionable insights for continuous improvement and innovation.Collaborate with developers and various business stakeholders to deliver high-quality results daily.Research, discover, and implement new ideas that can make a significant impact.What You’ll Need to Succeed:4+ years of hands-on data science experience.Excellent understanding of AI/ML/DL and statistics, along with coding proficiency in related open-source libraries and frameworks.Experience in SQL and programming languages such as Python, PySpark, and/or Scala.Ability to lead, work independently, and be an integral part of a team.It’s Great if You Have:PhD or MSc in Computer Science, Operations Research, Statistics, or other quantitative fields.Experience in NLP, image processing, and/or recommendation systems.Hands-on experience in data engineering and working with big data frameworks like Spark/Hadoop.Experience in data science for e-commerce and/or online travel agencies (OTA).Must haves :German & English speakingOnsite Looking for full timeFor more information on this job role , email me at Gianni@next-ventures.com :)

Digital Waffle is proud to have partnered with a company at the forefront of the renewable energy revolution, using artificial intelligence to optimise energy production, integration, and efficiency. At Dataiku, we're not just adapting to the AI revolution, we're leading it. Since our beginning in Paris in 2013, we've been pioneering the future of AI with a platform that makes data actionable and accessible. With over 1,000 teammates across 25 countries and backed by a renowned set of investors, we're the architects of Everyday AI, enabling data experts and domain experts to work together to build AI into their daily operations, from advanced analytics to Generative AI.The role of a Data Scientist at Dataiku is unique. Our Data Scientists develop solutions to real-world problems and participate in client-facing endeavors throughout the customer journey. This includes supporting their discovery of the platform, helping integrate Dataiku with other tools and technologies, providing user training, and co-developing data science projects from design to deployment.Just as non-technical skills are important, so are technical skills. Our Data Scientists work on the Dataiku platform daily. Aside from the visual tools, our team uses mostly Python, with occasional work in other languages (e.g., R, SQL, Pyspark, JavaScript, etc.). An ideal candidate is excited to teach customers data science, how to use the Dataiku platform, and learn about new technologies.How you'll make an impact Help users discover and master the Dataiku platform via user training, office hours, demos, and ongoing consultative support.  Analyze and investigate various data and machine learning applications across industries and use cases.  Provide strategic input to the customer and account teams to help our customers succeed.  Scope and co-develop production-level data science projects with our customers.  Mentor and help educate data scientists and other customer team members to aid in career development and growth. What you'll need to be successful Curiosity and a desire to learn new technical skills.  Empathy and an eagerness to share your knowledge with your colleagues, Dataiku’s customers, and the general public.  Ability to clearly explain complex topics to technical as well as non-technical audiences.  Over 3 years of experience with coding (Python, R, SQL).  Over 3 years of experience building ML models.  Understanding underlying data systems and platform mechanics such as Cloud architectures, K8S, Spark, and SQL. Fluency in English and German, French would be a plus.What will make you stand out Experience with Consulting and/or Customer-facing Data Science roles.  Experience with Data Engineering or MLOps.  Experience developing WebApps in Javascript, RShiny, or Dash.  Experience building APIs.  Experience using enterprise data science tools.  Passion for teaching or public speaking. BenefitsExposure to a wide range of enterprise customers across industries. Examples of Dataiku’s hundreds of customers include GE, Unilever, Comcast, Ubisoft, OVH, Santander, and Capgemini.A wide diversity of projects.Opportunity to contribute to our company's and product's core vision: simplify and democratize how people work with data and use Artificial Intelligence.Exposure to the latest open-source technologies that Dataiku integrates.Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate, and driven team in hypergrowth mode.Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Transparency, Ambition, Excellence, Humility, and Empathy.What are you waiting for!At Dataiku, you'll be part of a journey to shape the ever-evolving world of AI. We're not just building a product; we're crafting the future of AI. If you're ready to make a significant impact in a company that values innovation, collaboration, and your personal growth, we can't wait to welcome you to Dataiku! And if you’d like to learn even more about working here, you can visit our Dataiku LinkedIn page .Our practices are rooted in the idea that everyone should be treated with dignity, decency and fairness. Dataiku also believes that a diverse identity is a source of strength and allows us to optimize across the many dimensions that are needed for our success. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment practices are based on business needs, without regard to race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, veteran status or any other aspect which makes an individual unique or protected by laws and regulations in the locations where we operate. This applies to all policies and procedures related to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, performance, promotion and termination and all other conditions and terms of employment. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please contact us at: reasonable-accommodations@dataiku.com

Are you passionate about energy efficiency and sustainability? Are you looking to work on enabling Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) applications for Maritime industry? Can you add more senses to everyday objects and spaces? Do you possibly have a small home automation project of your own? Big data and artificial intelligence are not just buzzwords but familiar concepts for you?If that resonates with you, you might be the Data Scientist ALFRED Maritime GmbH is looking for! Jump in and join our enthusiastic core team to craft completely new things for the maritime industry. The core team’s ultimate mission is to make greener future for the shipping industry using machine learning and the smart controls.We also acknowledge that our task is not easy and therefore customer collaboration is of utmost importance and essence to succeed. In practice this means working with, listening, and learning from the numerous subject matter experts in the maritime sector.Here Are Some Qualities We Are Looking For Highly motivated, outgoing, and creative individual who really believes work can be fun. Passionate to improve and adapt the today’s technologies for a better, greener, tomorrow. Enjoy venturing with new technologies and not at all afraid of creating something completely new what hasn’t been done before.Your Responsibilities Will Be To understand the big picture and work with SMEs to arrive at business case. To quickly visualize and test hypothesis based on data for a given problem. To design, develop and optimize predictive data models to a given problem that can save costs, increase sustainability, create more revenue, or simply create completely new revenue streams. To question the status-quo of an existing industry practices and lead it into new greener waters. To analyze data and develop algorithms to process, assess and clean data. To collaborate with diversely skilled core team and come up with ideas for installing new sensors and IIoT infrastructure components for identified problem.Keys To Success In This Role Master/PhD in STEM subjects or equivalent. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English. German and Finnish is a bonus but working language is English. A good understanding of software best practices (versioning (GIT), profiling, clean code (PEP standards), debugging etc.) as well as ML techniques (data cleaning, preprocessing, feature engineering and hyper parameter tuning etc.). A good handle on ML/DL methods for time-series prediction/forecasting. 3-4 year field experience in data science or an equivalent outstanding academic record. Strong programming background (Python preferred) and ability to write queries for SQL and NoSQL databases. Good experience in building Data models for new business domain from production quality data with high throughput, veracity and verity with no or limited access to existing reference data models. Good understanding of popular ML Frameworks (i.e. TensorFlow, Apache Spark etc ) and varied managed ML services offered by Azure/AWS/GCP etc. providers. Ability to understand the big picture in the overall architecture on how the varied data set, data models fit it to solve a business problem.  Good interpersonal and teamwork skills with ability to work in international team. Helps: Experience in working with Scrum. Plus: Experience in cloud technologies (preferably Azure) is seen as a big bonus. Big plus: Experience in working with operational data sets of IIoT or Smart building environment.What We OfferWe offer you a flexible hybrid office environment, competitive salary, access to an online professional training platform amongst other perks like sponsored gym membership, Deutschland ticket and bicycle or an e-bike lease.At ALFRED you sit at the front seat for watching and defining the shape of cruise vessels in the future.Please send us your application in English, including your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date.If you have any questions, please contact Kathrin Ballin-Fisch (Kathrin.Ballin-Fisch@meyerwerft.de).

Die PAUL Tech AG ist Technologieführer der Immobilienwirtschaft mit der Mission Gebäude klimaneutral zu machen. Unsere selbst entwickelte Technologie, bestehend aus IoT-fähiger Hardware und KI-gestützter Software, optimiert dauerhaft die wasserführenden Systeme in Gebäuden. Das spart CO2-Emissionen und Energiekosten. Davon profitieren alle: Eigentümer, Betreiber, Bewohner und das Klima. Wir bei Paul sind Forscher, Entwickler und Praktiker mit dem gemeinsamen Ziel intelligente Lösungen für Gebäude zu entwickeln, um dem Klimawandel entgegenzutreten.Zur Unterstützung unserer Abteilung Data Science & AI in Mannheim oder Berlin suchen wir Dich als Senior Machine Learning Engineer (m/w/d) mit folgenden Schwerpunkten:Arbeiten mit großen Datenmengen im Bereich Energiewende und CO2 ReduzierungAnwendung von Machine Learning Methoden zur Steuerung von >5000 AnlagenEntwicklung eines Steuerungsalgorithmus zur Generierung von EnergieeinsparungenMitarbeit im agilen Team bei der Weiterentwicklung unserer Techniken und SystemeEinbringen von Impulsen und neuen Methoden aus dem Bereich AI / Machine LearningDas bringst Du mit:Ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Data Science, Mathematik, Physik oder vergleichbare QualifikationFundierte Berufserfahrung im Bereich Machine Learning / AI mit PythonSouveränes Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und SchriftPragmatismus und echte Hands-on-Mentalität für ein sich schnell entwickelndes UmfeldAusgepräge analytische, konzeptionelle und strukturierte ArbeitsweiseHaben Dich die Aufgaben überzeugt? Dazu bieten wir Dir:Eine sinnstiftende Tätigkeit, welche weltweit zur CO2-Einsparung beiträgtEine kollegiale Arbeitsatmosphäre mit kurzen EntscheidungswegenEinen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag mit überdurchschnittlichem Gehalt30 Tage Urlaub pro Kalenderjahr sowie zusätzlich der 24.12. und der 31.12. freiBetriebliche private Krankenzusatzversicherung und AltersvorsorgeZuschuss für Firmenfitness in deiner Region sowie Corporate BenefitsRegelmäßige Firmenevents, zu denen Du herzlich Willkommen bistDeutschlandticket sowie Getränke und Obst in unseren Büros

Enerlytica ist der Spezialist für Datenanalyse im Energiemarkt. Unser Fokus liegt auf der Analyse von Smart-Meter-Daten mit dem Ziel, Menschen bei der Reduzierung ihres CO2-Fußabdrucks und ihres Energieverbrauchs zu unterstützen. Unsere Kunden sind hauptsächlich Energieunternehmen, denen wir dank einer tiefgreifenden Expertise, einer langjährigen Erfahrung und eines hochspezialisierten Technologie-Stacks schnell und effizient helfen. Unsere Leistungen reichen von der einmaligen Datenanalyse bis zur Entwicklung, Umsetzung und Implementierung unserer eigenen Softwarelösungen zur fortlaufenden Analyse von Smart-Meter-Daten. Deine AufgabenEntwicklung und Optimierung von Datenpipelines zur Integration, Bereinigung und Aufbereitung von DatenWeiterentwicklung unserer Energy Analytics Platform mittels statistischer Modelle und ML-Algorithmen Entwicklung und Ausführung von Datenbereinigungsprozessen zur Identifikation und Korrektur von Anomalien und Datenfehlern auf Basis fortlaufender DatenströmeVerbesserung der Datenqualität und Gewinnung von Einblicken in komplexen DatensätzenNutzung von Datenbanken, Data Warehouses und Data LakesTechnische Unterstützung und fachliche Beratung in Kunden- und Forschungsprojekten, besonders in Bezug auf datengetriebene Technologien und AnalysemethodenDein ProfilAbgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium in technischem Bereich mit Fokus auf Datenanalyse und Datenmanagement3+ Jahre Erfahrung in einer Rolle, die Aspekte von Datenengineering, Datenanalyse oder Data Science umfasstErfahrung in Entwicklung und Management von Datenpipelines sowie von datenbasierten AnwendungenSehr gute Kenntnisse in R oder Python und sowie solide Grundlagen in SQL, statistischen Methoden und ein gutes Verständnis von Machine-Learning-Algorithmen (z.B. Clustering, Regressionsverfahren)Erfahrung mit Cloud-Diensten (AWS oder Azure) für datengestützte Lösungen sind ein PlusKombination von kritischem Denken, Freude an der Problemlösung und ausreichend PragmatismusHohes Maß an Sorgfalt, Zuverlässigkeit, Selbstständigkeit und TeamfähigkeitErfahrung im Energiemarkt und dem Umgang mit Energiedaten sind ein PlusSo arbeiten wir zusammenWir sind ein kleines, aber sehr gut ausgebildetes und damit schlagkräftiges Team von Expertinnen und ExpertenWir arbeiten an unseren Standorten in Zürich und München – allerdings den Großteil im HomeofficeNiemand bei uns ist ein Einzelkämpfer – trotz der räumlichen Trennung arbeiten wir sehr eng zusammenDu kannst und sollst von Beginn an Verantwortung übernehmen, wirst aber nie alleine gelassenDu erhältst viel Flexibilität in der Strukturierung Deiner Arbeit und ArbeitszeitGemeinsam treiben wir die globale Energiewende voran, um die Welt für kommende Generationen grüner und sicherer zu gestalten und besser zu vernetzen

Wir bei Comparus begleiten seit mehr als 20 Jahren unsere Kundinnen und Kunden, die üüberwiegend aus dem Bereich der Finanzdienstleistungen und Banken stammen, erfolgreich bei der digitalen Transformation. Unser Beitrag reicht vom agilen Projektmanagement über Datenmigration bis zur Entwicklung digitaler und innovativer (Software-) Produkte. Zum Erfolg von Comparus tragen maßgeblich unsere mehr als 100 Mitarbeitenden bei.DARAUF KÖNNEN SIE SICH FREUEN:Sie verantworten das Design, die Entwicklung und Implementierung von Machine-Learning- und Deep-Learning-Modellen zur Lösung komplexer ProblemeSie übernehmen die Analyse großer Datensätze sowie die Datenaufbereitung und -bereinigung, um hochwertige Eingabedaten für Modelle zu gewährleistenSie wirken an der Erstellung von Prototypen und Proofs of Concept für AI-Lösungen mitSie optimieren Modelle hinsichtlich Leistung und EffizienzSie arbeiten eng zusammen mit Data Scientists, Softwareentwickelnden und Produktmanagern um AI-Lösungen in Produkte zu integrierenSie verfolgen die neuesten Entwicklungen und Trends im Bereich der künstlichen IntelligenzDAS MACHT SIE AUS:Sie verfügen über eine abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Informatik, Mathematik, Data Science oder einer verwandten DisziplinSie verfügen über mehrere Jahre Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Implementierung von AI- und ML-ModellenSie verfügen über fundierte Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Machine Learning, Deep Learning, statistische Modellierung und AlgorithmenSie haben Erfahrung mit Programmiersprachen wie Python, R oder Java sowie Frameworks wie TensorFlow, PyTorch oder KerasSie haben tiefgreifende technische Kenntnisse mit Datenbankmanagement und -abfragen, insbesondere mit SQL und NoSQL-DatenbankenSie verfügen über starke analytische und Problemlösungsfähigkeiten, einen ausgeprägtem agilen Mindset und sind mit der Anwendung von Tools im Rahmen der agilen Softwareentwicklung vertrautIhnen ist die Arbeit mit internationalen Teams vertraut

Grammarly is excited to offer a remote-first hybrid working model. Team members work primarily remotely in the United States, Canada, Ukraine, Germany, or Poland. Certain roles have specific location requirements to facilitate collaboration at a particular Grammarly hub.All roles have an in-person component: Conditions permitting, teams meet 2–4 weeks every quarter at one of Grammarly’s hubs in San Francisco, Kyiv, New York, Vancouver, and Berlin, or in a workspace in Kraków. This flexible approach gives team members the best of both worlds: plenty of focus time along with in-person collaboration that fosters trust and unlocks creativity.Grammarly team members in this role must be based in Germany or Poland, and they must be able to collaborate in person 2 weeks per quarter, traveling if necessary to the hub(s) where the team is based.The opportunity Grammarly is the world’s leading AI writing assistance company trusted by over 30 million people and 70,000 professional teams every day. From instantly creating a first draft to perfecting every message, Grammarly’s product offerings help people at 96% of the Fortune 500 get their point across—and get results. Grammarly has been profitable for over a decade because we’ve stayed true to our values and built an enterprise-grade product that’s secure, reliable, and helps people do their best work—without selling their data. We’re proud to be one of Inc.’s best workplaces, a Glassdoor Best Place to Work, one of TIME’s 100 Most Influential Companies, and one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies in AI.To achieve our ambitious goals, we’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our growing Data team and community. This role is integral to Grammarly's Platform Data Science team and involves close partnership with the Quality organization. The Quality organization equips teams, all Grammarly employees, and ultimately the users with comprehensive, understandable, and actionable insights into the effectiveness of our features in addressing user issues. The position facilitates rapid, data-informed product evolution through established quality metrics and evaluation tools.The Grammarly data teams are trusted subject matter experts who uncover new insights to inform marketing, product, and growth strategies that drive outcomes at the highest levels of the company. We have large datasets and are looking for folks with deep technical and analytical skills who can break down complex business problems and provide solutions with high visibility and impact for the company.Grammarly’s engineers and researchers have the freedom to innovate and uncover breakthroughs—and, in turn, influence our product roadmap. The complexity of our technical challenges is growing rapidly as we scale our interfaces, algorithms, and infrastructure. You can hear more from our team on our technical blog.Your impactAs a Data Scientist, Quality, You WillLeverage various data science methods such as machine learning, statistical modeling, and causal inference to understand Enterprise account behavior and optimize the product experience.Tackle some of our company's most challenging and critical data problems today, which will shape Grammarly’s growth.Create, analyze, and monitor crucial metrics and indicators that reflect Grammarly's product quality and user engagement, directly supporting the mission of rapid product iteration based on solid data.Examine the effects of user engagement on product and marketing experiments, aiding teams in making informed decisions. Collaborate with Product, Marketing, and Engineering teams to set up, test, and evaluate hypotheses. This central role in testing and iteration is vital for the team's product development strategy.Collaborate with other Data Scientists to continue enhancing the methodologies and practices used across the team and leveraging the newest technological developments in the industry.We’re Looking For Someone WhoEmbodies our EAGER values—is ethical, adaptable, gritty, empathetic, and remarkable.Is inspired by our MOVE principles, which are the blueprint for how things get done at Grammarly: move fast and learn faster, obsess about creating customer value, value impact over activity, and embrace healthy disagreement rooted in trust.Is able to collaborate in person 2 weeks per quarter, traveling if necessary to the hub where the team is based.Holds a PhD or Master’s degree in a quantitative field.Has 5+ years of relevant work experience.Has a strong understanding of statistical concepts with practical application in business environments, including A/B testing, offline evaluations, and metric validation.Knowledgeable in standard regression and classification methods, beneficial for developing and validating metrics. Experienced in A/B testing and other measurement strategies to discern correlational and causal relationships among variables. Skilled in SQL, Python, PySpark, etc., ensuring accurate and efficient data retrieval for analysis.Has a self-starting growth mindset and strong communication skills, translating technical insights into impactful business recommendations.Can collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as Engineering, Product, and Data Platforms, to define metrics that align with the organizational vision and measure performance.Support for you, professionally and personallyProfessional growth: We believe that autonomy and trust are key to empowering our team members to do their best, most innovative work in a way that aligns with their interests, talents, and well-being. We also support professional development and advancement with training, coaching, and regular feedback.A connected team: Grammarly builds a product that helps people connect, and we apply this mindset to our own team. Our remote-first hybrid model enables a highly collaborative culture supported by our EAGER (ethical, adaptable, gritty, empathetic, and remarkable) values. We work to foster belonging among team members in a variety of ways. This includes our employee resource groups, Grammarly Circles, which promote connection among those with shared identities including BIPOC and LGBTQIA+ team members, women, and parents. We also celebrate our colleagues and accomplishments with global, local, and team-specific programs. Comprehensive benefits for candidates based in Germany: Grammarly offers all team members competitive pay along with a benefits package encompassing life care (including mental health care and risk benefits) and ample and defined time off. We also offer support to set up a home office, wellness and pet care stipends, learning and development opportunities, and more. Note that benefits may differ by location.We encourage you to applyAt Grammarly, we value our differences, and we encourage all to apply. Grammarly is an equal opportunity company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race or ethnic origin, religion or belief, gender, disability, sexual identity, or age.For more details about the personal data Grammarly collects during the recruitment process, for what purposes, and how you can address your rights, please see the Grammarly Data Privacy Notice for Candidates here.All team members meeting in person for official Grammarly business or working from a hub location are strongly encouraged to be vaccinated against COVID-19.

About Us: We are working with an innovative insurance tech startup based in Berlin, dedicated to revolutionizing the insurance industry with cutting-edge technology and data-driven solutions. The mission is to provide customers with personalized, efficient, and transparent insurance services. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a Head of Data to join our team and lead our data strategy.Job Summary: The Head of Data will be responsible for developing and executing the company's data strategy, ensuring data-driven decision-making across all departments. This role requires a strategic thinker with strong technical skills and experience in the insurance industry. Babbel is the top-selling language learning platform globally. We are driven by our purpose of creating mutual understanding through language. Through the Babbel app, Babbel Live classes, Babbel podcasts, and Babbel for Business products, we provide learners with the most effective solutions, enabling them to communicate in real-life scenarios with real people.The Babbel team is as diverse as our content. With headquarters in Berlin, Germany and our US office in New York, we're a team of 1,000+ people from over 80 different nationalities.For more information about Babbel and our language learning solutions, please visit www.babbel.com or download our app from the App Store or Play Store.We are looking for a Data Scientist for our Experimentation Data Team in the heart of buzzing Berlin!You will work in a cross-functional central data team that owns an Experimentation Platform, you will participate in the development of the experimentation platform as well as working closely with product analysts and product managers to optimize our product and features through experimentation, research, and data analysis.You will:Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, run, analyze, and gather insights from A/B tests using our experimentation platformDevelop and maintain pipelines, tools, and dashboards to improve our experimentation capabilitiesProvide guidance to product analysts on statistical methodologies, and using our statistical features effectively for more velocityPromote best practices for experimentation across the organizationLeverage techniques like meta-analyses, causal inference, and heterogeneous treatment effects to answer key business questionsContribute to insights and findings to feed our product knowledge baseYou have:An advanced degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or related quantitative field3+ years experience conducting data science projects, ideally including A/B tests and experimentation related topicsA proficiency in statistical analysis, Python and SQLAn ability to communicate complex analyses to non-technical stakeholdersA passion for collaborating cross-functionallyNice to have:Previous experience with A/B testing or experimentation platformsSome perks of becoming a Babbelonian:Enjoy 30 vacation days and the chance to take a 3-month Sabbatical. Plus family and life situation counseling.Decide how, when and from where you want to work with our flexible working hours and remote friendly options as Jobbatical (up to 3 months inside the EU) or work from our fully equipped office with nap, faith and family rooms.Learn and grow with the internal learning opportunities, and use a yearly learning & development budget for external training. Learn languages with Babbel for free with your full access to Babbel & Babbel Live classes.Take advantage of your mobility benefits options and a discounted Urban Sports Club membership.Be part of our employee communities (such as Femgineers, DE&I Ambassadors and LGBTQIA groups), attend cultural and regular social events.Diversity at BabbelAs part of our ongoing journey towards building a diverse, equitable and inclusive company, we welcome everyone to apply, especially those individuals who are underrepresented in tech. We are a learning company, inside and out, and we encourage you to apply even if you do not fit all the technical requirements - all candidates are assessed based on skills, qualifications and on our business needs. Please state your pronouns in your application, and let us know if you’d like to be addressed by a name other than the one appearing on your official documents. If you have a disability or special need, feel welcome to inform us, so that we can provide you with the proper assistance in the application process.Sounds good? We are already looking forward to hearing from you! Check out also our jobs page, our blog and our techblog to get an impression about #lifeatbabbel!

job_title: Data Scientist - Insights (Ranking) | Paid relocation to Barcelona, Spain
job_description: At Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That’s why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.Meet the team!The ranking team at Preply owns one of the key touchpoints for our learners, developing the tutor ranking algorithms that power our search page. You will work with a cross-functional product team with expertise in data science, machine learning and MLOps to help guide the direction and understand the impact of our production models, helping our learners find the best tutor possible.What You’ll Be DoingDiving deep into the behavior of our users to identify new opportunities;Experiment design and pre and post experiment analysis, to dig into what experiments are telling us and use these learnings to help shape future direction;Exploring, testing and productionising new features used in our core ML algorithms;Problem sizing and estimating the impact of new initiatives;Help refine product initiatives into lean, experiment-led technical implementations;Participating in the definition of engagement metrics and key performance indicators;Partnering with ML scientists and engineers to test new approaches and build new data assets.What You Need To SucceedStrong background in experimentation and causal inference;Ideally 5+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst or Data Scientist working in search, ranking or recommender systems;Strong Python and SQL experience;Bachelor's degree in a relevant technical field;Knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.);Ability to apply statistical techniques to derive meaningful insights and make data-driven decisions;Exhibiting strong curiosity, problem-solving skills, and the ability to identify and address underlying problems;Emphasizing a creative mindset and proactively engaging in the formation and evaluation of new hypotheses;Possessing strong written and verbal communication skills in English.Nice To HaveExperience working with ML products and engineersExperience with modern MLOps tooling, such as MLFlowExperience with SparkWhy you’ll love it at PreplyAn open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;Not in Barcelona? We offer an attractive relocation package to join us in our Preply Barcelona HubAccess to free mental health support platforms;Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).Our PrinciplesCare to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don’t fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.Diversity, Equity, and InclusionPreply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

job_title: Python Engineer / Data Scientist (Open-Source; Full Remote + Office in Berlin)
job_description: Help us make https://github.com/SuperDuperDB/superduperdb greater than it already is, enabling developers to build AI (apps) with their existing data infrastructure, without needing to move data through intricate pipelines.SuperDuperDB, a solidly funded startup, is looking for an experienced machine learning & Python engineer who knows the core machine learning and AI algorithms inside and out, has applied these to data in the field, and has also deployed these to production. The candidate we are looking for should have serious experience developing production-grade Python.We are a small team, growing quickly, of absolute experts who are building an open-source system to effortlessly integrate AI and databases. SuperDuperDB has the potential to disrupt how AI is developed and implemented - and to become the new standard for doing AI with your data. The position is the opportunity to build SuperDuperDB and its community from the ground up.Our open-source environment https://github.com/SuperDuperDB/superduperdb enables developers to easily implement next-generation AI models and applications on top of your existing data store - from LLMs, and public APIs to custom high-performance in-house machine learning models. It transforms your favourite data store into a vector database, feature store, model repository, performance monitor and end-to-end live AI deployment including model training and computation of outputs all at once!A record of work around open-source Python projects in AI/ ML/ Data would be very attractive to us. You can be fully remote, or work at our Berlin office. Salary is competitive incl. stock options and the existing small team is first-class.TasksContributing to the project's open-source codebase by writing high-quality Python code and adhering to coding standards and best practices.Identify, develop and implement exciting and relevant applications and use cases that show why and how SuperDuperDB leads to great gains in AI development, training and deployment. (Optionally present your work in various content forms such as notebooks, technical talks, tutorials, blog posts, demos, videos, podcasts etc.)Collaborating with other developers and the open-source community, participating in code reviews, and providing feedback and suggestions to improve the project.Staying up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in Python and related technologies, and sharing knowledge and insights with the rest of the team.RequirementsIn-depth experience building and applying AI, machine learning, data science, and MLOpsProficiency in Python and other relevant languagesKnowledge of the scientific Python ecosystem including Pandas, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn, Numpy, Tensorflow etc.Knowledge of and experience with popular databases, including SQL-based RDBMS, MongoDB and othersGood understanding of developer and open-source communitiesVery good written and verbal communication skillsNice to have: Visible contributions to starred, active open-source GitHub projectsBenefitsHigh-impact work with other highly-talented and skilled team membersCompetitive salary and stock optionsThe choice between fully remote work and hybridWe would be happy to hear from you. Please send whatever you think is necessary including your GitHub and LinkedIn profile, a few words about yourself, as well as your salary expectation and earliest starting date.

About the Company21.co is the world’s leader in providing access to crypto through simple and easy to use products. 21.co is the parent company of 21Shares, one of the world’s largest issuers of cryptocurrency-backed exchange traded products (ETPs) – which is powered by Onyx, a proprietary technology platform used to issue and operate cryptocurrency ETPs for 21Shares and third parties. 21Shares. was one of the first to issue a bitcoin ETP in 2019 and manages a suite of ETFs in the U.S., including a spot bitcoin ETF and 40’ Act vehicles.The company has offices in Zurich, London, and New York. 21.co was founded in 2018 by Hany Rashwan and Ophelia Snyder. Wednesday, in a hybrid model.

Company DescriptionMAKE-IT-SIMPLE SA is a company founded in 2017 with the aim of providing IT services to SMEs in the Romandy region. This project emerged from a desire to better serve local SMEs by offering them tailored, proximity-based services to meet their needs. MAKE-IT-SIMPLE SA aims to become the IT competence center for businesses lacking an IT team, offering services ranging from infrastructure to managing digital business processes. Our team caters to the needs of SMEs by providing a single point of contact. Through strategic partnerships, we address the "gray areas," setting us apart from our competitors.Role DescriptionThis is a full-time hybrid role as an Information Technology Consultant at Make-IT-Simple located in Morges. As an IT Consultant, your day-to-day tasks will include providing technical support, analyzing data, and offering IT consulting services. This role requires a combination of on-site work in Morges and at customer sites and the flexibility for some remote work.QualificationsSkills in IT Consulting, Information Technology, and ConsultingStrong analytical skillsExperience in technical supportRelevant skills and qualifications that would be beneficial for this role include knowledge of project management and excellent problem-solving abilities.

Warum wir nach den Sternen greifen. Und wie wir sie gemeinsam erreichen.Kennst du den "5-Sterne-Willen"? Wir bei achermann haben ein ganz klares Ziel: Exzellenz in allen Bereichen. Als Dienstleistungsunternehmen begeistern wir unsere Kunden mit hochprofessionellen ICT-Services, verfolgen darüber hinaus das Konzept von New Work und setzen dabei auf den selbst entwickelten «Managed Modern Workplace». Mit diesem Ansatz unterstützen wir Unternehmen dabei, ihre Arbeitsumgebungen zu optimieren und auf die sich ständig verändernden Anforderungen der modernen Arbeitswelt einzugehen. Unser respektvoller Umgang untereinander zeichnet uns aus und verbindet uns als Spitzen-Team. Passt du zu uns? Passen wir zu dir?Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine/nSystem Administrator (80-100%, m/w/d)für unseren Standort in Kriens (LU) oder dem modernen NEW WORK Office in Rüti (ZH).Als System Administrator sorgst du für einen reibungslosen Betrieb der IT bei unseren Kunden. Du nimmst dich den täglichen IT-Problemen/Anfragen unserer Kunden an und überwachst die ICT-Services, welche unsere Kunden vor Ort oder in unserem Datacenter im Einsatz haben. Du stellst die Wartung und den Support der eingesetzten Cloud oder On-Premise Lösungen sicher und behebst Störungen via Fernwartung oder falls erforderlich beim Kunden vor Ort. Du bist ein Teil des Support Teams, unterstützt beim Bearbeiten von technisch komplexen Supportfällen (Second-Level) und stellst so den operativen Betrieb unserer Services sicher.Dein HintergrundDu bist eine empathische Persönlichkeit und verfügst über eine engagierte und selbständige Arbeitsweise. Idealerweise bringst du folgende fachtechnischen Kompetenzen mit:Abgeschlossene Informatikausbildung in Systemtechnik oder adäquate WeiterbildungMehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Unterhalten von IT-SystemenBerufserfahrung und Know-How in den Bereichen Windows 2016/19 Server und Windows Active DirectoryKenntnisse im Bereich Firewalls und Know-How im Unterhalten von Microsoft 365 Anwendungen sind von VorteilHohe Dienstleistungsbereitschaft und KommunikationsfähigkeitFreude am Bearbeiten von komplexen SupportfällenStilsicheres Deutsch und gute EnglischkenntnisseWir bietenEinen abwechslungsreichen Job in einem kollegialen, engagierten und qualifizierten Team. Durch die gebotenen Freiräume kannst du etwas bewegen - auch über die Teamgrenze hinaus. Zudem bieten wir dir attraktive Anstellungsbedingungen wie flexible Arbeitszeiten und fördern deine berufliche Weiterentwicklung. Du gestaltest deine Arbeitszeit flexibel im Jahresarbeitszeitmodell und wählst zwischen unseren modernen Arbeitsplätzen oder deinem eigenen Home-Office.Möchtest du ein Teil der achermann-Familie werden und gemeinsam mit uns unsere Kunden begeistern? Dann sende uns dein vollständiges Bewerbungsdossier.Wir freuen uns auf dich!

Founded in 2020, KIDAN is a family-owned IT consultancy based in Switzerland, dedicated to providing comprehensive IT management and security solutions to over 760 enterprise clients. We are your trusted IT partner, delivering tailored solutions that address unique business challenges and align with your vision.Our team of international experts empowers organizations of all sizes to navigate the technology landscape and unlock their maximum potential. As the exclusive Swiss distributor for ManageEngine and a key partner for world-class software providers, we help businesses maximize their IT capabilities, transforming IT from an expense into a strategic priority.Join us in creating a secure and efficient future where IT drives business success.TasksWe are on the lookout for a dynamic IT Infrastructure Specialist who is ready to make an impact as a consultant. If you're technically skilled in enhancing IT infrastructure for diverse clients and/or managing internal IT operations, this role is your chance to shine. You'll have ample opportunities for professional growth and to make a significant mark in the IT management sector by wearing multiple hats.Key ResponsibilitiesInnovative Client Solutions: Assess clients’ IT infrastructure needs and craft tailored solutions based on our portfolio.Pre-Sales Support: Lead product demonstrations and technical presentations. Solution Design and Implementation: Develop and implement IT infrastructure solutions to meet business and technical requirements. Sales and Marketing Support: Collaborate with sales and marketing teams to drive growth. Post-Sales Support: Provide consulting and operational support post-implementation. Technical Support: Offer pre- and post-sales technical support, including product demonstrations and resolving technical issues. Empower Clients: Educate and empower clients with the latest tools and best practices through engaging consulting and training sessions.RequirementsSwiss residency Fluent in English and French; proficiency in German and/or Italian is a plus 4+ years of experience in IT infrastructure and/or networking Great understanding of IT management, networking, and cybersecurity Hands-on experience with infrastructure tools like a SIEM, NMS, Endpoint Management, etc.Why KIDAN?Join KIDAN if you want to be part of a human-sized, multi-cultural, and ambitious family-owned company where care, respect, and ethics are at the core of our culture. Here, you’ll find a vibrant and fair atmosphere that encourages experimentation, innovation, and collaboration. We’re not just a company; we’re a rapidly growing "near to established startup" offering you the unique opportunity to shape your career and make a significant impact.At KIDAN, you won’t just be another employee. You’ll be a crucial part of our journey, contributing to exciting projects and witnessing the tangible results of your efforts. We value continuous learning and provide ample opportunities for professional development. Our team thrives on creativity and teamwork, ensuring that everyone’s voice is heard and valued.We’re looking for passionate individuals who are ready to take on responsibilities, eager to learn, and driven to work collaboratively to build something great. If you’re ready to contribute to our growth story and make a real difference, KIDAN is the place for you.Who Should Not Join UsThose who expect to do the minimumThose who are afraid of responsibilities and accountability Those who do not want to progress Those who do not want to participate directly to the good and bad
